Love is very special and not many people are capable of being loved. But, no matter what the feeling of love is one of the best feelings yet. When even the smallest thing reminds you of them. You look at that thing and smile thinking about that person.Each night you go to sleep thinking about that person.Each morning you wake up thinking of that person.You are with them you feel great and just wish that time would stop.Whatever they say makes you smile and laugh.You just can’t get your eyes off of them.Everything else seems wrong but, they are the only ones that are right.You try every way to make them happy and smile.Everything seems so beautiful. Even the things that you didn’t like before you start loving.Life finally starts making a little sense.Sometimes you sit there staring into space and smile about nothing.Every time you see that person your heart skips a beat.And those who are not so lucky of seeing their love every day. Their heart starts beating like crazy and they start jumping up and down and screaming out of happiness when they finally see the person that they have waited so long to see.You start doing really stupid things for no reason.Every time you are with them bubbles of happiness blast out inside of you.You become a little more mature and realize that money is not everything. Love is much more important and valuable.You are having a really rough day and just one single message from them shifts your mood entirely and make you really happy. That message doesn’t even have to be an I love you message it just can be really casual.You might be angry at them for not talking to you for days. But, as soon as they respond all that anger just evaporates.Sometimes when you think about them it hurts yet, you still keep thinking about them and the times that you spent together.And sometimes you even stalk them.You observe them and carefully see what they like and not like.You too start developing their habits which could either be good or bad. For example you notice that your love says “Oh! Man! I am dead!” every time they laugh really hard and the next time you laugh you start saying it too without realizing that you are saying it because of that person.When you see a picture of them no matter how ugly you still love it. Hay mein marjawah.When forgetting them hurts a lot.Even if they have made many mistakes you are willing to expect them with the flaws that they have and love them just the way they are.Then there is those who while reading this answer think of someone. Someone whom they love and that is when you know that either you crossed the wrong path or fell for the right person.Love is something unexplainable. Each person feels love different;y and based on who they fallin love with how they feel love also changes. Regardless love is a beauttiful feeling and we should enjoy it when we can because we might not always be in love. Lots of love, Simran Patel

You see a future with this person.You find them physically, sexually and most importantly, emotionally attractive.You'd rather see them happy than seeing yourself happy.It makes your heart ache when you see that person suffering from anything whether it's physical, mental or emotional.You respect that person and his/her values, likes and dislikes, morals, limits and the people that he/she respects.Ego isn't an issue when it comes to this person.You don't hold your grudges or use their past actions to win an argument.You are able to forgive, very easily.The thought of winning doesn't exist anymore. The need to be superior and dominant doesn't seem to be a need anymore.You aren't afraid to be vulnerable.You trust them with your deepest & darkest secrets. You count on them with anything.Your require their attention. A lot probably. And when you don't get it, you feel upset.You feel safe to cry. You don't regret those actions.You arent afraid of commitment, you are willing to compromise & sacrifice. Willingness alone isn't enough, you must prove it to yourself by actions. Not once, not twice but multiple times in multiple circumstances.You accept their flaws. You accept them as the person they are, even when they are at their worst.You make time to make your partner happy no matter how busy you are. And you don't feel guilty about the sacrifices you make just put a smile on your partner.You have been faithful and are willing to stay that way forever.You are ready let them go if that's whats best for them or you are ready to walk away forever if that's what needs to be done.You have an immense amount of tolerance when it comes to this person.Patience isn't forced anymore. It comes from within.A particular person came to your mind as you read those points.And if you could put on a tick ( √ ) on each and every one of those, Congratulations.

Look at a photo of your person of interest. Does the profound beauty of everything within the lines of their face hit you full force? Does everything seem to slow down around you just slightly when you look into their eyes? How does their voice feel coming over the phone on a bad day? is everything suddenly golden after seeing their name pop up? Do you dream about them? How often? How do you feel when you wake up? True love, in my experience, provides an incredibly peaceful feeling. Something akin to meditation. Utter openness. It also causes extreme excitement at unexpected times, a profound motivation to be near and around the person, and some sadness when they aren't around. You'll find yourself grateful for every opportunity to connect with them. Passionate about their interests. Amazed by their actions. You should be careful. Love is a drug unlike many other human pursuits. It will change you if it is really true. “Dear little sweetheart. Once again I’ve let a few lazy days slip by without accomplishing anything. You know, the kind of days when you sleep late because there’s nothing important to do, then go out until the room has been made up, and then study until fatigue sets in. Then you loaf around for a while and half-heartedly look forward to dinner, listlessly contemplating highly philosophical questions while whistling a little… How was I able to live alone before, my little everything? Without you I lack self-confidence, passion for work, and enjoyment of life — in short, without you, my life is no life.”-Albert Einstein “Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don’t blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being “in love”, which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident”.-Louise de bernieres “It’s to do with knowing and being known. I remember how it stopped seeming odd that in biblical Greek, knowing was used for making love. Whosit knew so-and-so. Carnal knowledge. It’s what lovers trust each other with. Knowledge of each other, not of the flesh but through the flesh, knowledge of self, the real him, the real her, in extremis, the mask slipped from the face. Every other version of oneself is on offer to the public. We share our vivacity, grief, sulks, anger, joy… we hand it out to anybody who happens to be standing around, to friends and family with a momentary sense of indecency perhaps, to strangers without hesitation. Our lovers share us with the passing trade. But in pairs we insist that we give ourselves to each other. What selves? What’s left? What else is there that hasn’t been dealt out like a deck of cards? Carnal knowledge. Personal, final, uncompromised. Knowing, being known. I revere that. Having that is being rich, you can be generous about what’s shared — she walks, she talks, she laughs, she lends a sympathetic ear, she kicks off her shoes and dances on the tables, she’s everybody’s and it don’t mean a thing, let them eat cake; knowledge is something else, the undealt card, and while it’s held it makes you free-and-easy and nice to know, and when it’s gone everything is pain. Every single thing. Every object that meets the eye, a pencil, a tangerine, a travel poster. As if the physical world has been wired up to pass a current back to the part of your brain where imagination glows like a filament in a lobe no bigger than a torch bulb. Pain.”-’the real thing’ play.

We sing about it, write about it and watch movies about it, but when you think about it, falling in love is crazy and maybe even weird.It makes us feel and do things we usually wouldn’t under any other circumstances. First of all, it physically affects our hormones and brain. In fact, scientists have shown that love affects the brain in a way similar to cocaine addiction. Not only that, it also affects us psychologically and behaviorally  some weird symptoms-  Your hormones go wild When you fall in love, your cheeks flush, your heart beats faster, your palms are sweaty and your head starts spinning. This is all thanks to a rush of chemicals and hormones that flood your brain and body when you fall in love.This leaves you with feelings of euphoria similar to an endorphin-induced “runner’s high.”There’s nothing you can do about this; love physically makes you crazy. You wake up and go to sleep thinking of someone other than yourself From the moment you wake up in the morning to the moment you go to sleep at night, the person you love occupies at least some part of your mind. How does your brain even know to think of that person first thing in the morning? Doesn’t it have other more important things to worry about?The truth is this phenomenon is usually subconscious and automatic, almost like your mind is programmed to do so. Even throughout the day, that person stays staunchly in the back of your mind.As crazy as it may be, it is nice to think of someone beside you every once in a while. You smile when you’re alone We’ve all seen them: the smile texters. Smile texting is the perfect example of what happens when you’re falling in love. You experience weird, giddy feelings of happiness, even when you’re not physically with that special person.You might smile when he or she texts you, when you hear a certain song, see a picture on Facebook or when you just think of that person.In general, little things like that will make you smile more than usual because you are just so blissfully in love (and because of all those happy hormones flowing through your bloodstream).People may look at you funny and wonder why you’re so happy, but you don’t even mind You become a little obsessive  I wonder what she’s doing right now. I wonder if she’s watching the game. She loves football, which is cool for a girl. But I forget what her favorite team is … I need to ask again. Or maybe I should ask now. I’ll mention it if she texts me later.Oh look, a bag of chips. She loves chips. But only the BBQ kind.  People in love, love to think about each other. They somehow manage to relate even the smallest things to the person they love. If your life is the universe, then chances are, your love is the sun, and everything revolves around that.  You do embarrassing things Ever heard those sappy stories of boys in the olden days throwing rocks at a girl’s window, and playing her songs on their guitar? That was then, but today, there are videos all over YouTube of men proposing to their fiance with elaborate flash mobs that take place in front of hundreds of people. Love will make you do embarrassing things because when you’re falling in love with someone, you will do almost anything to make him or her happy, no matter what other people may think You do things outside of your comfort zone Along the same lines, falling in love will make you do things you never even considered doing before. Boys, that may mean taking a yoga class or going to get a pedicure with your girlfriend (they feel really good, it’s okay to admit it).Girls, that may mean watching “SportsCenter” for two hours or playing a couple games of FIFA. Of course, doing these things can open your mind to new activities you might enjoy. Doing them with the one you love is a great bonding experience, too You suddenly care more about your appearance  Before, you may have rolled out of bed and thrown on some athletic shorts and a t-shirt, but you now have a reason to try to look good. You might comb your hair more often, double check to make sure you didn’t forget deodorant, shave more meticulously and go to the gym, instead of falling asleep on your couch after work You sing  When you’re falling in love, you feel so happy and carefree, you can’t always keep it inside. Whether you sound like William Hung or "Ariana Grande", sometimes, you just have to sing at the top of your lungs to let it all out. You go out of your way You may find yourself driving out of the way to pick up your love’s favorite dinner, or calling in sick to work just to hang out with him or her. The crazy part is that even though these things may inconvenience you, you’re happy and excited to do them. You actually take joy in making that extra effort to please your SO and show him or her how much you care You go blind As the old adage goes, love is blind. When you’re falling in love, everything your love does and says is interesting and amazing. Every word uttered from his or her mouth, and every move he or she makes, is magical. Love blinds you to faults and screw ups, and even when you do notice them, you’re quick to forgive because your love can do no wrong. As it turns out, KeSha might be right about this one: Love is a drug. It makes us crazy, but it also makes us happy. Love is exciting; it’s addicting, it’s confusing and it’s weird. So, cheers to love: both our worst nightmare and our best friend. <3 <3 <3 <3 <3

Very simply … there is one question you can ask yourself, and if the answer is “yes”, you will absolutely know without a doubt that you love this person. So what is this magic question? Well before I reveal it, I think it's important to realize that we’re not alone in wondering what being “in love” is. We don't have a simple definition in English for such a complex emotion.  Love has many subtleties. We have several words to describe love in English, yet still there are some shades within the spectrum of that emotion we haven’t been able to capture in our own language. Here are some interesting examples of foreign words relating to love that we don't have in English:  Koi No Yokan – Japanese The sudden knowledge upon meeting someone that the two of you are destined to fall in love. Unlike the phrase “love at first sight” Koi No Yokan doesn’t mean that the feeling of love is already there when meeting someone, rather this describes the concept of feeling like love is inevitable. It’s looking at someone and feeling those sparks that a deeper romantic connection is possible.  Mamihlapinatapei – Yagan A wordless, yet meaningful look between two people who both desire to initiate something, but both are too scared to initiate themselves.  Forelsket – Norwegian That overwhelming euphoric feeling you experience when you’re falling in love with someone.  La douleur exquise – French The heartbreaking pain of wanting someone you can’t have. La douleur exquise is not the same as unrequited love – the state of one desiring another they can’t have. This phrase is meant to describe the emotional experience and heartbreak of being the person whose feelings and desires aren’t returned.  Ya’aburnee – Arabic This phrase translates to “you bury me.” This is the hope that the person you love will outlive you so you can spare the pain of living without them.  Saudade – Portuguese The feeling of intense longing for a person or place you love but is now lost. A haunting desire for what is gone.  Kara sevda – Turkish Meaning “black love” this is a lovesick term for when you feel that passionate, blinding love for another person.  Kilig – Tagalog The heady-sublime rush you experience right after something good happens, particularly in love/dating. Like running into your crush, kissing someone for the first time, hearing someone you love tell you they love you too for the first time.  Gigil – Filipino The urge to pinch or squeeze something that is irresistibly cute.  Cavoli riscaldati – Italian This literally means “reheated cabbage” but the phrase describes the moment when you attempt to start up a failed relationship or love affair.  Yuanfen – Chinese A relationship by fate or destiny. In common usage yuanfen means “the binding force” that connects two people but it’s an ambiguous term. Although it can be a complex concept, it essentially draws upon the principles of predetermination in Chinese culture that dictates relationships, particularly in love, friendship, and business. It is the idea of bringing two people together that were destined to meet.  Ok ok, I know you’re ready and just want to know the simple question to ask yourself to know if you're “in love”. I hope that by seeing there are many ways to describe and define loving feelings in other cultures, you'll see it’s not entirely your fault that you’re unsure of your own feelings. Yes, blame it on our inability to define something so complex. If you want to know if you’re “in love”, here is the simple question to ask yourself … and a simple “Yes” or “No” is the only way to answer: “If this person was completely disabled and stuck in a hospital bed for the rest of their life, and I was able, would I stay by their side and take care of them”  Wow, that got dark fast. Well, if you think about this for a minute and realistically the answer is “no”, you are not alone. This is a very big deal and would take you sacrificing much of your own life's comfort for someone else's. Life will not be easy forever - you will go through hardships (hopefully never this drastic). If you said “no” to this question, please don't worry as it doesn't mean you don't have love for them at all, but it does reveal something extremely important about your true feelings and the relationship. Your definition of love may be different than theirs - and it's important that love must be returned equally for it to work long term. I'm divorced from a woman I loved dearly, and I learned this lesson the hard way. I personally wouldn't call what you're feeling as being “in love” if you can't answer this with a definite “yes”. I also would not marry another person if I couldn't answer “yes” to this question about them and they couldn't say the same thing back without thinking. -ZAKARY STAHLSMITH Follow me for more and/or upvote this to make my day P.S. If you can't tell by now - I love the movie Princess Bride. Seriously go watch it on Netflix with the family if you haven't yet. Even my 14 year old son liked it! And this is my cat Westley (if I got a girl cat she would have been Princess Buttercup, no doubt). He's a one year old tabby I saved from a local shelter and he has asthma. Yes, cats can have asthma as weird as that sounds and he needs his inhaler twice a day to avoid asthma attacks. I promise to give little Westley a rub on the head (he prefers his head being rubbed over his body) for each upvote to this answer. Yes, you can make my day … and Westley’s day. Will he get 100 head rubs today?

Love is a stupid emotion. You know that tingly little feeling you get when you like someone? That’s common sense leaving your body. That’s love happening… Love is just a word until someone comes along and gives it a definition.  According to me, love is an emotional feeling which reminds you of someone or something. A time spent which is always worth your tears. If I look back on my memories of childhood, I can remember an ugly looking doll which I loved the most. Often my parents got me new good-looking toys, but I always held that ugly one. My parents were mad about why can't I like these beautiful things and I loved that ugly one. Probably that was my first love.  When I experienced my first stupid one-sided love for a someone I was around 14. Since then, the stupid one-sided has been constant, the definition of love has kept updating. Recently, I got attached to someone whose definition of love was quite different from mine. She is quite different than me I really find her special. That’s how it goes, right? Different and Special.  My writing made me fall in love with two beautiful persons. The one who finds me special and the one I find. The one who understands me and one I tried to. The one who is my mother and the one who is currently someone.  A moment after I posted one of my answers and was re-reading it, there were two lines written by me which pushed me into this deep unending thought process of defining love. Beginning: “This answer is for my love, only credential love?” End: “Thank you for giving me this answer love and making me believe that love hurts. Indeed it does.” Apparently that time my second credential was Something Lover and the answer that I wrote was a story related to something. After slogging my fingers for 7 hours I completed the answer and now I was trying to find an answer to my own question, only credential love? Damn, why did I write this… My research began and the journey of discovering this answer was the most beautiful yet painful exploration.  The story which I wrote was witnessed by me that day when someone woke me up in the morning at 5 AM like no one before. (I asked for it, a trust) I stopped asking for the reviews of my answer because I suddenly fell in love with my writing. I wrote a few flawless poems, although lame and wrote so much that I felt like a writer. Also the last text, I received from someone was, “You are becoming a Writer.” Initially, my thoughts were that all this is for the love of my game, then I thought probably it’s for my writing.  Often we push our limits in love and do silly things. I also committed some similar mistake. If I was the old me, I would have slept. I was going through a rough phase of life, jobless, laptop broke down, huge financial stress, mental pain and growing physical pain, I would have been frustrated and angry. But I was happy as I was writing for that someone. After 7 hours, I spend 7 more hours in cooking her answer (which was probably quite dumb), until my hands were numb in pain. A dark answer which landed me into my dungeons of pains, often I could visualize someone alongside. The excruciating pain of numerous people who always cheated and backstabbed me was growing in my head with emotional setbacks.  Who is this someone? Someone I find very special, in her apt words Angel. I feel she might be there in my life for a long time. As a friend, maybe a crime partner, a listener, sometimes the speaker, a guide and often an inspiration. Her crisp and precise writeups, which often speaks her heart content made me fall in love with her. Maybe only her writing? Maybe words are the best language of love and that is why I could feel the pain beneath her writings. The scars of her past is very deep and unimaginable, took me months to realize.  I was getting deeply and emotionally attached to her, a feeling that I never wanted to develop. I always knew that she was not emotionally available. She probably doesn’t love her own self at present, so loving anyone is long way. She is quite similar to me, trying to please everyone at own cost. She often tries to understand me and when she will, she might know what I feel at the moment. I remember all of these moments because of it being cherishable, ecstatic, jubilant, euphoric and what not. In my mind, I started thinking that all this feeling, all this imagination, all these poems, all these writeups centred around her might not be worth the time and tears later. I was into her so much that for some moment that literally saw everything destroyed and felt like dying inside. I never wanted to complicate things in my mind but it just happened…  A week after I had to convey my feelings because it was killing me from inside. I was selflessly being dragged into this dungeon of dark thoughts mostly. The air between felt convoluted and something was not right with me. My draft overflow with the content that is for her. I was happy, I wrote. I was sad, I wrote. I missed her, I wrote. Missing her hurts, really. The pain was, is overwhelming. All I can, or want to think of was her. All I could, or wanted to write, should have her. What did she do to me?  Often you live through my words. Don't you see that? They say you write your heart content beautifully. Is it? Is this love? Why so much? Not because of a pretty face or an old crush, it’s because I think you fill a lot of pieces that I am missing, it’s because I can count on you to push me to my limits. Really, it’s because I plan on winning life and I think you can help me and maybe we can have a lot of fun, if together. I don't expect and I don't want anything, because it's not the time. Not today.

When you look forward to hearing or seeing them even if it's for a short while.When you see things that they do or their characteristics (their favorite things, they way they speak etc) in other people/ outside places - And it immediately brings you memories of that person. The thoughts of this person can bring a smile to your face even when you're tired to the bones.When you can see a future for yourself, and you see that person being a part of it - You somehow manage to fit them there! You have glaring differences between yourselves, yet you don't disrespect or force your opinions into the other person's space. You just let them be! When you can dream their dreams. It excites you when they tell you what they want to do in life, and all you want to do is see them through it. When a text from them in the middle of the day can put a smile to your face. When you can spill your darkest, innermost secrets to them, and not worry about being judged for those. When love songs actually being to make sense. (Stealing this point from some other post.. LOL!)Whether it's a happy news or a sad one, you want to tell them about it first thing! When you can talk for hours strung together, and still there are things aplenty left unsaid. Even in a jam packed day or schedule - You can make time for them. Same way, even in a jam packed room - your eyes can spot them easily! You can read their eyes and read the unspoken messages. Silence doesn't intimidate you. It just sits comfortably between you - like a well acquainted friend.Seeing them smile or hearing their laugh makes your day. You try to make them feel better when they're down - For their smile matters to you!When they're sick, it sends panic waves in you. Whether it's common cold or flu, you wish it gets done quickly. You pick up their tastes and do things that they love, even if you're not a great fan of it yourself. Simply because you care about them. You think of them even when they're not around or in conversation. It doesn't necessarily affect your flow of thoughts, but in the recesses of your mind - They're always there! Most importantly, it brings out the best in both of you. You strive to be a better person or at least a person better than yesterday's version when you love. Love brings your innate strengths to the fore.

( I genuinely didn't wanna write about this as I don't want her to read this but since she does not follow me here, I am fine ) The girl in question is my ex- girlfriend (let's say Girl A) with whom I fell hopelessly in love and dated for a few months before she dumped me and decided to move on. I never stopped loving her after she left and the breakup was too hard on me. I spent endless nights drowning my sorrows in whiskey hoping to get her out of my head but couldn't. The more I tried, the more I missed her. I even involved myself in a meaningless relationship with another girl ( Girl B ) because my friends suggested this would help me move on. That didn't turn out well because I was always bringing Girl A into our conversations and Girl B felt intimidated at times. In fact, even sleeping with Girl B didn't help because I woke up the next morning every single time and missed Girl A even more. It got to the point where I realized that this was no crazy infatuation that would die out in a couple of months as I expected. So I decided to end it with Girl B for good. I continued with my earlier lifestyle of drinking liquor with and drunk dialing her sometimes so that I could just hear her voice. Little by little, I tried suppressing my feelings for her and I was partly successful because I had cut down on my drinking even though I still missed her a lot. A few months later, she called me out of the blue and we started catching up on lost time and decided to be friends again. We would call each other all the time and share every little detail about our day and it reminded of the time we were dating and just brought all those feelings back, except this time I could see and meet her often and listen to her soothing voice everyday. Until recently, we had a fight over something stupid and I overreacted and since then, we haven't said a word to each other ever since. I want to apologise except I don't think she will forgive me because I was too harsh on her during my outburst which she didn't deserve. I still love her though and miss her dearly and here are some things that remind me why I am in love with her : Every time I see a notification on my phone, I hope it's from her.I wake up, I see a hundred texts from acquaintances, pesky relatives, football groups but not one from her - I leave the messages unread and put down my phone again.I had lost my love for travelling since my college days and rarely went out of town. She had this infectious energy that reinvigorated my love for travelling and now I effectively go on trips each month.Sometimes, I get really mad at her and want to say a lot of things but when I see her face or hear her voice, my heart melts and I forget my anger totally.She has the most beautiful eyes and I could stare into them all day long.She has a shy smile that is the most beautiful sight in the world and I would give anything to see it everyday.She likes to talk a lot and I am a good listener, she is like a walking FM that I am addicted to.She is a little chubby but she thinks she is fat and this doesn't help her confidence but this is something I never cared about.I like how her eyes light up when I surprise her with chocolates.When she gets mad, there isn't anything I wouldn't do to calm her down and lighten her mood.She gives the most relaxing back massages that anyone could ever imagine.Sometimes I feel sad or upset and I just look at her old photos and they cheer me up.I used to write her little quotes every night describing how much I love her after she went to sleep so that she would wake up to something nice each day.I could probably go on & on and never run out of reasons but I feel this is enough to tell you how much I am in love with her :)

You will find excuses to stay with her. He will go to the extent of creating situations so that he can be with you. So don’t be surprised if he asks you to help him with his maths worksheet even when he is the master of maths ;-)He will be very protective. You wanna test this ? Try crossing a busy street along with your guy. I bet he will hold your hands and while crossing the road he will walk beside you in such a way that if a car hits, he will be the one to get hit first.He will never fail to surprise you and make you laugh.He will smile and blush whenever your name comes up. I have seen the saddest face glowing with joy.He will cook for you. He will learn to cook your favourite dish.He will be jealous if he spots you talking with some other guy. He will keep taunting you for this. Yes we can be irritating. Please tolerate us. We love you if we know how to irritate you.He will tell his mom and sister about you. The most important sign.His heart will cry when you are in pain.He will play with your hair. We guys love running our finger through your hair.He will hold that strand of hair and gently put it behind your ear.He will never ask you to sleep with him against your wish. He will respect your decision and won’t stop loving you even if you say NO. You will have to initiate the talk if you want to have it. If happens otherwise, it’s a warning sign .We are afraid to lose you for something as superficial as sex and we respect you too much to see you naked. You want to have it after marriage, fair enough. It’s your life, your decision. Not even God has the power to go against you.He will treat you like you are a part of his soul and he is incomplete without you. You will never get the feeling that you are being used.He will treat you like a precious diamond or a delicate doll. The care and the gentleness with which he handles you will melt your heart my friend.He will kiss you on your forehead more than he kisses you on your lips.He will plan everything. We guys have solution to all the problems when it comes to living with our love. For example- If your parents are against love marriage. Your guy will create such a scenario that no one will get a hint about your relation, Till your names have been beautifully scribbled on wedding invitation.He will never give up on you. When you start freaking out. He knows how to calm you down. He will be your paracetamol in fever called life.You are his medicine for all his problems. Your voice. Even a missed call from you is enough to lift him up in his life.He cannot imagine his life without you in it. You are his oxygen, his H2O and every damn thing which is necessary for life.He will give you subtle hints like talking about family and kids. What do you think ? We talk about kids with every girl? No dear, kids freak us out. The only reason we are talking about kids with you is because we love you. We want our kids to look upto you and we know you will be a great mom.He has already started thinking about you as his wife. In his mind he has already changed your last name to his last name. This is the reason why he blushes when your teacher takes attendance by calling you with your full name.These signs are very superficial. The most important sign that you can rely on is your GUT FEELING. You will feel when he loves you. You will feel the gush in your blood. You will see it in his eyes.You will see it in his smile. These things will happen if you are in love.. Thanks for reading. Edit: my crush saw this answer and now maybe she's impress a little bit…cuz this is all about her :P

Here is the story of how I knew I was in love. I had been dating a woman I knew in a desultory manner when she told me she was having a party and that there would be many women there. I am guessing she was as tired of me as I was of her. However, when I arrived at the party I discovered it was a "sausage fest", all men and few women. So after making a couple of passes through the room I decided I had had enough and went to find the hostess to say thank you and leave.  When I found her she was talking to a woman who was sitting on her washing machine and laughing. I found the woman on the machine totally unattractive but I joined in the convo and soon it was just myself and this woman sitting on the machine. At that point in my life I was feeling very confident in myself. I was completely in shape, training for triathlons, meeting women, coming up in my career and so on. So after a few minutes of pleasant conversation I asked this woman for her number, feeling that I was "doing her a favor". She wrote t on a card and I stuck  it in my pocket and left and instantly forgot all about her. A week later while doing the laundry I  came across the card in my pants and decided to grace her with my presence and called to set up a date. Yes, I know I was being an arrogant asshole. When I went to pick her up at her suprisingly lovely house she invited me in and showed me around. Not only was she an accomplished musician, she was a competeten artist painting in oils and talented and spoke three languages. She kept a beautiful, stylish house with complex gardening she did herself. I was humbled and impressed. We passed a fun and enjoyable date, with laughter, no discomfort or awkwardness or unpleasantness and I asked her for another.  Our third date was set for Sunday at 3 PM. Without any clue in my head as to what I was doing I found myself pulling into her driveway at 1PM. I was completely confused. Not only could I not wait to see here, I felt I HAD to see her. Never having been in this position before, I drove to a nearby diner and read the paper, looking at the clock every 30 seconds waiting for it to be 3PM. For the life of me I could not figure out what the hell was going on. But when she finally opened the door at 3PM it was as if I had been struck by lightening. I was in love, and had been, but hadn't known it before. But I knew it then. And I knew she  was "the one". After only three dates, and without any real intimacy whatsoever I knew she was the one as I had never known anything before in my life.  So being a  moron, I wrecked the relationship in a bird-brained attempt to be perfect, do the perfect things, plan the perfect dates, say the wittiest perfect thing and so on. After a few more weeks she broke up with me. "I just can't tell who you are anymore." I was not surprised -- neither could I.  She later married someone else, had twins and moved to another state. Fifteen years later I still sometimes check her out on Facebook or whatever, recalling the fateful words of poet John Greenleaf Whittier, "The saddest words of tongue and pen -- the saddest are these, it might have been."

Oh I've been waiting a long time to answer this and answer it right. I'm gonna sway around and get distracted but bear with me. Once upon a time, in this social media frenzy world, I was the user of Twitter. I'd crack the lamest jokes, come up with the worst puns and still manage to get a few likes coz obviously I'm a chick. I made a lot of male friends over dm’s and somehow it was just annoying to hold a conversation (I get distracted a lot). One fine day, this person comes along and starts talking about one of my favourite vadapav joints in Ahmedabad and we didn't stop talking about how delicious vadapav really is. I'm such a fan I could eat it everyday. This person found my blog too and appreciated it quite a bit. He had fallen for me way before I even knew him. Then he “slid” into my dm and the approach he used was so unnatural I had to reply back. Again, being the distracted lazy bum that I am, I'd conveniently forget about replying etc. Now this person held my attention the way no one had. We talked about the universe. How it came into existence, how we feel energies, how love devours and yet frees you. Wham! One day I was in love. JUST LIKE THAT. I went ‘wtf’ because I know myself. I was a shitty lover and a more selfish person. Some days (months) later we started what was going to be the biggest fucking adventure of my life. And we've just strapped ourselves in. Now, how do I know I'm in love? Well, I love to feed him my share of food and anyone who knows me well knows I don't part with my food. I have changed in ways I never thought I would. My partner has helped me grow in a way that's so holistic and natural, my parents appreciate it. Oh and my parents love him. Every waking moment of life since I've known him, I think of him. He's the biggest support system I have. Every time I feel even a little pain anywhere he comes along, swoops me up and plants a kiss on my head. Honestly it's the best thing ever. I love being a kid around him. I love being a lady around him. His eyes speak so much, he never needs to say it to me (trust me, I've never been the reading eyes kinda gal). All I want to do is to hold him forever, to never have him feel pain, to never letting things bother him. He envelops me like a human igloo (I ain't calling you fat, Robbie). To cherish what we get bestowed with is one of the greatest gifts we give ourselves. It makes me sad to see people being with their husbands and wives and not loving each other. To see their partners as a competition. Only when you share love will you get more love. And I give full credit to my wonderful hoo-man for inculcating the values that I forgot I ever had in me.

Love can sneak up on you when you least expect it. I had been accepted in the American Airlines "stewardess" training program back when it was a more glamorous career. This happened in January and training was scheduled for September. I was enjoying my job as a research assistant in child abuse at a well respected medical center, dating medical students and interns, one of whom had already professed his love for me. I spent weekends skiing and went to Canada for a week with the local ski club where I caught the eye of   the man of the hour, an older, charming great looking fella who drank too much. His reputation for loving and leaving women was well known. Oh well, it's only for a week. I didn't hear from him when we got back, but I had plenty of attention to keep me busy. But soon the call came to go skiing. Sure, why, not? He picked me up in a Porsche. Gulp, I'm such a pushover for European sports cars. Still I knew that if I didn't beat him to the bottom of the mountain (hard, because he was a better skiier than I), he would be chatting it up with whatever woman he rode with on the ski lift. As winter turned to summer, he introduced me to sailing. Up to one end of a 26 mile lake, camp on an island, sail back on Sunday. What heavenly delight! Still, waking up one morning I noticed his greying beard, smelled the vodka on his breath and said to myself, "what am I doing with this old drunk?" When meeting people on the island, they would invaryingly joke "Is she your first mate?" And I would reply "Not the first and not the last!" With my leaving on the horizon in September, I still had my head on straight, although I can say it was the best "send off " I could possibly have imagined. Until he said he loved me. What???? And then he proposed. With a ring and everything.I did not cancel my departure, but asked for an extension. No one could believe the mighty Harry had been "caught", least of all me. I think we had 60-90 days of unbridled happiness before it all went south.  It was probably more complicated than this, but it seemed like the arguments began because I had the temerity to suggest we might set a wedding date. My world fell apart when we ended. Fell apart in every way. I never went to stewardess school, but my career life was a resounding success. I looked for pieces of him in men for the rest of my life.

The answer can change so much about your life, from how you interact with a current (or potential) partner to how you view yourself to what goals you have for the future. Think you might be in love? Gain some insight by considering these research-based signs of love and attachment. You’re addicted to this person. Love changes the brain. In early-stage relationships, that euphoria that people feel appears as heightened neural activity in dopamine-rich areas of the brain—areas linked to the reward system—and in areas associated with the pursuit of rewards. There’s even some hint of activity in the anterior cingulate, the area of the brain linked to obsessive thinking, which is a classic experience when people are falling in love (Aron, Fisher, Mashek, Strong, & Brown, 2005). As a relationship progresses into a long-term partnership, thinking about the partner activates the reward centers as well as brain areas implicated in attachment, but less so obsessive thinking (Acevedo, Aron, Fisher, & Brown, 2011).You really want your friends or family to like this person. New evidence shows that people are often motivated to “marshal support” for someone they are dating (Patrick & Faw, 2014), which is consistent with the idea that the people in a person’s social circle often play an important role in the success of a relationship (Sprecher, 2011). Being attuned to how your family and friends might think about your partner or potential partner is a good sign that you are becoming increasingly attached to the person.You celebrate this person’s triumphs (even when you yourself fail).If you’ve fallen in love with someone, you probably have an atypical reaction when witnessing them excelling at something you don’t. Because romantic partners feel connected and can share the outcomes of each other’s successes, romantic partners will often feel pride and positive emotions when they see their partner succeed, even at something they themselves can’t do, rather than feeling negative and inferior (Lockwood & Pinkus, 2014).You definitely like this person, and this person likes you.  Liking is different from love, but is often a prerequisite for falling in love. In a cross-cultural study, researchers showed that a critical factor recognized as directly preceding falling in love is reciprocal liking, when you both clearly like each other (Riela, Rodriguez, Aron, Xu, & Acevedo, 2010). In addition, an evaluation of the other person’s personality as highly desirable tends to be a precursor to falling in love.You really miss this person when you’re apart.In many ways, how much you miss a person reflects how interdependent your lives have become. If you are questioning whether you love someone, perhaps consider how much you miss him or her when you’re apart. Le and colleagues (2008) showed that how much people miss each other tends to correspond with how committed they feel to the relationship.Your sense of self has grown through knowing this person.When people fall in love, their whole sense of self changes. They take on new traits and characteristics, growing in the diversity of their self-concept through the influence of their new relationship partner (Aron, Paris, & Aron, 1995). In other words, the you before falling in love is different from the you after falling in love. Maybe you feel the difference, maybe others notice it, but the things you care about, your habits, how you spend you time—and or all of this is subject to the (hopefully positive) influence of a new romantic partner.You get jealous—but not suspicious.A certain amount of jealousy is actually healthy, not toxic. From an evolutionary perspective, jealousy is an adaptation that helps relationships stay intact by making its members sensitive to potential threats. People who are jealous tend to be more committed to relationships (Rydell, McConnell, & Bringle, 2004). Keep the jealousy in check, though: Reactive or emotional jealousy is the type that is predicted by positive relationship factors like dependency and trust—but people who engage in suspicious jealousy, which includes taking actions like secretly checking a partner's cellphone, tends to be associated with relational anxiety, low self esteem, and chronic insecurity (Rydell & Bringle, 2007).Falling in love and building an attachment are a wonderful basis for a healthy relationship, but keep in mind that staying in a relationship (or, for that matter, choosing to start one) is often based on more than satisfaction and feeling good in another person’s presence. Models of relationship success (such as Rusbult’s investment model) show that the staying power of relationships takes mutual investment and commitment. If love is passion, security, and emotional comfort, commitment is the necessary decision made within one’s cultural and social contexts to be with that person. Relationship observers—and people who watch romantic comedies—know that love needs the buttressing of commitment to flourish into a stable and healthy partnership.

Falling in love is one of the most exciting, rewarding and scariest things you could ever do. Once you’re in love with someone, it’s hard to remember how you lived without him or her. Of course, you were alive before you met this person, but you really didn’t start “living” until the two of you met. There are few things which will tell you that you in love : When after reading her message you start smiling.Seeing her in person is the best part of the day. No matter how your day must be going but seeing her always bring a smile on your face.You get angry when someone else comments about her.When you go beyond limits just to make sure that everything is perfect for her. For example: If I tried to construct a list of things I wouldn’t do for her, the list would be pretty empty. When you’re in love with someone, you do whatever you can to make her happy.My personal favourite : She is the first thought in your mind when you wake up and last thought before you go to bed :)When you listen to every little detail she expressed earlier and implement it afterwards to show that you really care.When her words like “Buddhu” and “Pagal”(mad) makes your day.When your face lit up as soon as she calls :)When she cracks a PJ and only you laugh because she was laughing.When her mood affects your mood.The best part is when you tease her about makeup and she being fat , she thinks that I am making fun of her but I was just truly admiring her beauty.You became a better person yourself just to impress her ;)When you just create unnecessary doubts in your subject , so you could discuss it with her in person as well as on the phone. That feeling is amazing ;)When suddenly you starts listening to romantic songs because that reminds you of her.When your feelings for her are unconditional i.e. you do things for her but does not expect anything from her. If that`s the case, then you are in true love :)When her needs became much more important than your own.Sometime along the way, I feel that she is my best friend. I believe this to be true for most people who fall in love.So how many of you are in love ?

Okay let me put it this way If when you look at him/her, (and I’m not even exaggerating one bit when I explain this to you) and all you can feel is butterflies and a warm tingling sensation in your heart that forces out your dorkiest smile you’re in love with them.If when you talk to him/her, you’re comfortably weird but also considerate of what you say and how you say it, expecting their reaction and appreciating their response whether it be good or bad, you’re in love with them.If when you seriously fuck up and he/she gets angry at you and doesn’t talk to you and you take things into your own hands, grow from the situation and appreciate and respect the fact that they cared enough to get so upset about it and see how they were only trying to help you, you’re in love with them.If you find yourself loving country music or any music, not because it’s their favorite type, but because everytime you listen to it, it reminds you of them- you’re in love with them.If you stare at him/her while they’re not looking and appreciate just the way they breathe, talk, listen, react, move and smile. you’re in love with them.If you haven’t seen each other for a while and you’re living of the pure hope of seeing them soon craving for their touch(their hugs the kind those make your heart beat faster). you’re in love with them.If you notice and find the silly quirks they have, like poking their glasses back up to their nose, or sniffing their nose to the side when they are upset, or tap their feet involuntarily when they’re thinking. Oh boy/girl, you are in love with them."Some people can love you more in a year than others could love you in fifty. Some people can teach you more within a single day than others could teach you over the entire course of a lifetime.PS: There are lot more other answers too. I don’t know much or to add something more different but i guess these are reasonable enough to know better and requite back. ATB!

For me I has never bee a love at first time, attraction sure, but it never moves to obsession or love , until I know someone very well. So for me love strikes during the due course of friendship and when that friendship transcends into love , I sit and look back at my actions and behavior for past few days and I am like “ oh, Shit you are knee deep into love”. For me it is as surreal as depicted in movies. It starts with very subconscious actions like hanging out more than usual. I can be find hanging around the person a lot, so much that people start taking notice of it and first person they contact when I am missing is well, you know. Soon after my brain starts registering my restlessness , my anxiety when I wait for their replies to my text and my stomach starts to churn with excitement when I converse , which never used too happen when we were friends. I never end the conversation, the chats , it goes on until the ‘person’ ends it . I can go on for ever. Finally when it fully strikes and I realize that I wake up and sleep with the thought of the same person in my head and I smile when the thought strikes. Then it all begins, bringing up their names in conversation to know about their whereabouts when I don’t see them. My eyes constantly searching for them and when finally I spot them, the smile on my face, my sinking heart and butterflies in my stomach all start working together. Just their voice lit my face, put a smile on my lips and sparkle in my eyes. Then I have this urge to get out of the limb to help them and to protect them no matter what, even if it means lose on my part. Then come the urges for physical touches , the smells and spending time alone. The final sign that now I am in love is jealousy. I become territorial and God, do I get jealous and try to intervene every other interaction of that person, not in malicious way but in that sweet rom-com way. The only difference is life do not have a background track but then what is the playlist for? When I put those head phones on every song is about us. Thanks for the question and making me relive those moment of love, it has been so long since I felt like this. Love thy name is sweet bitching poison!!!!

For me, I know I'm in love when I want to sacrifice some of my own time and energy, so that the person I'm in love with is happy and content with his life.  I find that people realize they're in love when they can't stand the thought of living their lives without the other person. It also has to do a little with attachment, but that's another topic for another time. But when the thought of losing someone becomes so unbearable that you think you'd rather die - you're so screwed! And you're also pretty much in love. But don't take this the wrong way - it's only a feeling, a very intense emotional impact when you think you might lose that person. Mature people obviously know that they CAN actually live without them. Another crucial thing that happens is that you inexplicably realize that the well-being, success, goals and needs of the person you love suddenly become extremely important to you.  Since people are inherently selfish and everyone lives for themselves - it's something as special as love that makes someone want to spend a lot of their own time and effort on the person that they love as much as on themselves. Finally, the thing to realize is that love can be of many sorts - parental love, romantic love, friendship love, etc. All of those require commitment and attachment on your part, and once you cross the threshold where you would get incredibly emotional even at the thought of losing that person somehow - that's how you know you're in love. That feeling builds gradually over time. Just don't confuse this with extreme possessiveness. I don't really believe in the butterflies in your stomach - that feeling is infatuation and lust, but not love. If you found this insightful, check out my profile or follow me on Quora for more solid dating advice. Cheers!

Okay , so here it is. For example , a boy and a girl are friends . They don't talk directly to each other , but they chat and share their feelings with one another . The girl knows whom to speak to when she is depressed or is in trouble. Now , the boy , who is in his busy schedule and rigorous work , just removes a sec from his work and there pops a message on his phone that “ Can you help me ?” and he , helps her and comforts her each and every time she looks sad or disappointed. He asks himself , “ Why do I get so affected when she is in trouble ? And this doesn't happen 1 or 2 times , but a good 7 8 times. He makes her laugh , cares for her every single darn time . He waits for her to come online . Whenever she is online , he puts up a msg or a greeting for her to notice and talk to her. He just wants to bond with her and ask her about her daily routine . He comes forward and wants to know about her likes and dislikes. Whenever he puts up a msg, he waits for her reply . The value of that wait is priceless. When she reaches home , he calls her to ensure that she reached home safely or not . When she is not well, he calls or msgs her to take care of herself. When she is absent , he tries to know the reason from her or her friends . He feels lonely when she isn't there present alongside him . He keeps every single promise made to her . He automatically starts behaving differently . Even when she lies to him , he happily accepts whatever she says . He cannot watch a single tear roll down her cheeks . His day goes amazingly fabulous when he sees her smiling face everyday. It doesn't matter what problem he is facing or what situation he is going through , he just walks happily due to her sight . Whenever she is around , he shies away and controls his heartbeats . He gets incredibly jealous when he sees her talking to other guys or men . When the school or college leaves , he waits for one sight of her . He smiles sheepishly when she looks at him . He feels good just by her presence . He controls his emotions when he feels her around . He takes time just to chat with her . He saves each and every picture of her in his gallery . His mind goes for a toss when accidentally she touches him . He cares for her decisions and whatever choices she makes . And last but not the least , if he truly loves her , it doesn't matter if she is with him or not , he acknowledges her decision and choices and lets her live her life the way she wants and whoever guy she wants and loves . Hence , these are the many reasons when you get to know that you have truly fallen head over heals for someone.

I am at risk of giving an answer that is not really an answer, because I think the real answer is that ultimately, you never really know. Unsatisfying. I know. But anyway: I was completely certain beyond doubt that I was in love with my first boyfriend. I felt drawn to him. Woke up thinking about him. Wanted everyone to see I was the lucky girl who got to be with him. The thought of him made me dizzy in a good way. There were days in school, where I simply couldn’t concentrate, because my mind would keep replaying a fraction of a memory of a shared intimate moment over and over and I was unable to stop it. I was so sure I was in love - I even got a tattoo - not of his name, thank fuck, but of something that had more meaning to him than me and was meant to be a symbol of our everlasting love. Guess what? The relationship didn’t last, we broke up and very soon after I had a new boyfriend. This time I was really sure. I felt even more drawn to him. I woke up and went to bed thinking about him. The thought of him made me dizzy in ways I didn’t know existed before that. I almost dropped out of college for him. And you know what’s really funny - he was a tattoo artist - so I got tattooed again in honour of the relationship: This time even by him. This one crashed and burned really hard. I don’t like the label “abuse”, because there are always two sides to every story and we both inflicted our fair share of pain on each other, but the end of this relationship is still one of the worst memories I will ever have. I changed my views on what being in love meant after that. If what I’d felt in these two failed attempts had really been love and love could lead to this… well, then I just didn’t like it very much at all. When I met my current boyfriend, there was no dizziness. There was a lot of clarity in what we both wanted. There were lots of great conversations, lots of inspiring thoughts about ourselves and each other. We agreed on what we liked and what we wanted and how we enjoyed our time together. I’ve had other friendships start the exact same way. There was no “falling” involved in how we became a couple. No out of control can’t-help-it crash of emotions raining down on me. I loved him as a person long before I experienced any sort of chemical reaction. The feelings I have for him now, are deep and solid. So today I am again sure beyond a doubt that that must be what it feels like to be in love, because it’s just so much better and so much more profound. But I was sure the first two times, too. So I’ll just have to be content with settling on this definition, because I sure as hell don’t want to let him go, just to find out, if there maybe is something more. Maybe there always is something more, but there is something more in the depth of a relationship that works too. If you have to ask the question though, you’re probably not. It seems to come with some kind of, most likely very misplaced, certainty.

Suppose if you fall in love with her!! Your hormones go wild. When you fall in love, your cheeks flush, your heart beats faster, your palms are sweaty and your head starts spinning. This is all thanks to a rush of chemicals and hormones that flood your brain and body when you fall in love. You go blind. As the old adage goes, love is blind. When you're falling in love, everything your love does and says is interesting and amazing. Every word uttered from her mouth, and every move she makes, is magical. Love blinds you to faults and screwups, and even when you do notice her, you're quick to forgive because your love can do no wrong. You're comfortable with making little sacrifices for her. You wouldn't put off your responsibilities for her, but if she is sick and needs you to help take care of her instead of going to brunch one morning, you're totally cool with that. Little things, like going to the grocery store, are better when she's around. You re-read her text messages. This is an undeniable one. You keep the entire texting conversation you have with her. When she sends you a text, you often smile and read it a couple times just for good measure. You smile when you're alone. Smile texting is the perfect example of what happens when you're falling in love. You experience weird, giddy feelings of happiness, even when you're not physically with that special person. Two minutes with her is worth more than a whole day without her. Ever get a short text from her that sends a jolt of excitement through you and puts a smile on your face for the rest of the day? Does your heart skip a beat if she calls you just to say hi or to talk about anything for a couple minutes? You have more energy As you go through your day, you feel more alive and energetic, as if you have a constant adrenaline rush going through you. You feel more productive, like you can take on the world every single day. You do boring stuff with her just to have the chance to spend more time with her. Does she have to go to the super market because she’s out of fruits? Sounds like fun! No matter how boring it is or how much you’d normally hate it, you’d never turn down the chance to do it with her. You’re endlessly curious about her. You literally can’t help but be interested in every little detail about her. You do embarrassing things You do things outside of your comfort zone. You suddenly care more about your appearance. You sing. When you're falling in love, you feel so happy and carefree, you can't always keep it inside. Love is exciting; it's addicting, it's confusing and it's weird. PS : ;

You know you are in love when you have to snap out of it, or wander back into this sorry world ocassionally. You know you are in love when your waking moments are filled with dreams and your dreaming moments are filled with life.  You know you are in love when that person's thoughts consume your being, and they induce a dreamlike stupor, making you wander through mundane tasks like a zombie. You know you are in love when the first thing which comes to your mind when you think about your day yesterday is time spent with that special person. You know you are in love when you would rather worry about that person's lunch than your deadline. You know you are in love, when your expectations of that person grow manifold, and strangely, your excuses for that person grow concomitantly too. You know you are in love when their slightest faux pas will wrong you like the greatest crime, and their slightest kind word will reward you like the most exalted encomium. You know you are in love when their attentions to another will hurt you with more pain than thumbscrews. You know you are in love when you imagine your phone vibrating in your pocket, even if its not, and check it for messages every other second. You know you are in love, when you associate everything you come across with them, even if it is in the most convoluted manner humanly possible. You know you are in love when you seek to do things on the other person's behalf even without a request for help. You know you are in love when nature becomes all the more beautiful in your eyes, and seemingly mundane sights exhilarate you. You know you are in love when you answer questions like this despite seeing several answers purporting to do the same.

Easy: You just know. Because you decide to love. *** I was madly in love with someone who didn’t love me back. I was heartbroken. Hurt. Hopeless. My ego was shaken, shredded into many, many tiny pieces and I thought I couldn’t manage to forget him. The truth is, I even refused to forget him - because of his face, his attitudes, his thoughts and the possibility and the potential of our interaction - even after a year I was still hoping he would turn to me and say: “Keso, this is it - I fell in love with you and let’s be together!” but oh boy, it didn’t happen and I was worrying I would be like that for like forever until when I suddenly realized I do not care. At all. How? I just decided to not care about it. but HOW?! I agree. It takes a lot of work. On yourself. You should love yourself in order to make such decisions. Without self-help, self-compassion (but not self-pity) you can’t decide anything. Self love means developing confidence, rational mind. Self love means to know and love your emotions so much that you can control and move them into preferred direction. For example, if you can’t decide whether you love someone or not, just imagine being with him in a long run - would you go for it? The main goal of every relationship is to live together and help each other grow into something significant. Are you ready to make him your life partner? No? Because you’re scared and you hesitate? You are not ready for loving them. I mean, yeah, you may not have enough finances to live together, but you should be ready to PLAN ahead and making this person your goal. This is when you’re sure. But what if you’re not sure about them being your potential? Then it’s you, not them. You should practice self-love. Because self love also means being sure and confident about your life decisions. You should love yourself first to be able to make major life decisions. Everyone deserves to be loved, and you should respect every person enough to tell them the truth. The truth that is solid and firm - you either love them or not. Forget about the bullshit media, TV series and romantic movies are telling you - it’s either yes or no. There are no actual struggles, there is no timing, there are no real barriers - it’s YOU who defines your reality and life. and again, you need self love to realize that. Now, what if you’re already ready to plan and make them your future partner? That means you love them. Don’t worry about the future - it’s you who shapes it. Don’t make a tragedy out of it, if it’s temporary. Everything changes and accept it. and just relax, enjoy your love. It’s that simple, you know. I was stuck in past and the idealized future and heartbroken in present, so I couldn’t think clearly. I didn’t realize the reality around me. I thought the reality was creating me and my major plans, so I didn’t imagine him as my life partner. I just wanted to love him NOW! To have him NOW! Because I was not actually loving him, but I was IN love with him. Loving him means that you consciously CHOOSE them and MAKE them your life priority, and you simply know that it’s your future. You’re FREE at choosing your priorities. You DEFINE your future. You become one with the reality and it’s the real you and authenticity who decides. Love is not a feeling, it’s a verb, which is aroused by feelings. So it’s really beautiful. Well, I’m not saying that you should be with everyone who passes by - you can’t. Simply, because of your subjective nature and requirements. Your standards. Your feelings. Because loving thyself also means having standards. The existence of standards doesn’t exclude unconditional love. In fact, unconditional love is indeed quite conditionally based. We never choose someone who isn’t visually appealing and we know we won’t like them. We have to like them somehow in order to choose them. then we can love them unconditionally and selflessly. Everything else is just a myth and sentimentalism, that is quite overrated and is far away from the reality. It’s only true in religions, movies, books, TV shows and in fantasy, generally. After the heartbreak, I realized I had an opportunity. I started loving myself, developing confidence and rational mind, to think clearly and I suddenly noticed the guy, who is my boyfriend now and now I do LOVE him dearly and deeply. Because I decided to love him. I couldn’t make it work with just anybody, because real love is a byproduct of reality and self-love and familiarity and conscious feelings and something personal as well. So, all I wanted to say is that you just know, dear. You’ll just know and accept the fact that you love someone. Being IN love doesn’t require self love, but loving someone does. So, which one do you choose - being IN love and hurt, or really love-ing someone and being happy? Make your choice and shape it.

How do you know if you’re in love? The answer can change so much about your life, from how you interact with a current (or potential) partner to how you view yourself to what goals you have for the future. Think you might be in love? Gain some insight by considering these research-based signs of love and attachment. You’re addicted to this person. Love changes the brain. In early-stage relationships, that euphoria that people feel appears as heightened neural activity in dopamine-rich areas of the brain—areas linked to the reward system—and in areas associated with the pursuit of rewards. There’s even some hint of activity in the anterior cingulate, the area of the brain linked to obsessive thinking, which is a classic experience when people are falling in love (Aron, Fisher, Mashek, Strong, & Brown, 2005). As a relationship progresses into a long-term partnership, thinking about the partner activates the reward centers as well as brain areas implicated in attachment, but less so obsessive thinking (Acevedo, Aron, Fisher, & Brown, 2011).You really want your friends or family to like this person. New evidence shows that people are often motivated to “marshal support” for someone they are dating (Patrick & Faw, 2014), which is consistent with the idea that the people in a person’s social circle often play an important role in the success of a relationship (Sprecher, 2011). Being attuned to how your family and friends might think about your partner or potential partner is a good sign that you are becoming increasingly attached to the person.You celebrate this person’s triumphs (even when you yourself fail). If you’ve fallen in love with someone, you probably have an atypical reaction when witnessing them excelling at something you don’t. Because romantic partners feel connected and can share the outcomes of each other’s successes, romantic partners will often feel pride and positive emotions when they see their partner succeed, even at something they themselves can’t do, rather than feeling negative and inferior (Lockwood & Pinkus, 2014).You definitely like this person, and this person likes you. Liking is different from love, but is often a prerequisite for falling in love. In a cross-cultural study, researchers showed that a critical factor recognized as directly preceding falling in love is reciprocal liking, when you both clearly like each other (Riela, Rodriguez, Aron, Xu, & Acevedo, 2010). In addition, an evaluation of the other person’s personality as highly desirable tends to be a precursor to falling in love.You really miss this person when you’re apart. In many ways, how much you miss a person reflects how interdependent your lives have become. If you are questioning whether you love someone, perhaps consider how much you miss him or her when you’re apart. Le and colleagues (2008) showed that how much people miss each other tends to correspond with how committed they feel to the relationship.Your sense of self has grown through knowing this person. When people fall in love, their whole sense of self changes. They take on new traits and characteristics, growing in the diversity of their self-concept through the influence of their new relationship partner (Aron, Paris, & Aron, 1995). In other words, the you before falling in love is different from the you after falling in love. Maybe you feel the difference, maybe others notice it, but the things you care about, your habits, how you spend you time—and or all of this is subject to the (hopefully positive) influence of a new romantic partner.For more interesting stories, download the Lopscoop application from Google play store and earn extra money by sharing it on social media.

When you can answer positively to most of the following questions: - When you really have to define your feelings, apart from the fact you love each other, the bottom line is you admire him or her. - You listen and are listened to and when this happens you both feel you have benefited from the exchange. - You perceive your partner as your best friend and when in need of any kind, your first reaction is to communicate with her or him before anybody else - Each of you feels the other loves one, more than one loves the other - Deep down, in the very depth of your soul, almost atavistically you know this is the one, that you are really, really in love - Your most basic principles, core values and morals are almost identical even though you may have absolutely different personalities. This means when push comes to shove your core values are the same even though your styles may vary radically. You can survive personality clashes, but it is extremely difficult to survive principled inconsistencies. - You communicate, verbally, in silence, when apart or however it may be. You never or rarely stop communicating. Whenever you are apart and experience something new you miss having your partner by your side to tell them about it. - Even though you need each other you don’t strangle yourselves. You feel the need to be together but respect each other’s individuality. - You are absolutely honest about each other, your downfalls, your finances, your quirks, everything. You hide nothing from the other and feel no need to do so. - Both of you feel comfortable in each other’s family environment, meaning there are no great differences, even though there is not necessarily a great relationship. - You have similar or satisfy each other’s sexual needs. You know, understand and respect the sexual limits of one another. At the same time you also perceive what doors are absolutely closed and which, with time and patience, might be opened. - You have similar ideas regarding birth control and children (to have or not, number of children if any, their formation, education and each one’s responsibility in the process). - Your ideas respect of Religion, Politics and other sensitive points of view are the same, similar, or at most, close enough not to generate serious or irreconcilable differences in your relationship. - You understand once you are married you are a family unto itself, and are not only willing but also obligated to each other and to this “new” family over every other family relationship. - Overall you feel more complete as a couple than as an individual. - You laugh together more often than not. You have the capacity to laugh together and at the same time at each other without offense. - Each one of you wants to give the other happiness. - You both understand that all the differences, fights and troubles you survive together are but a strengthening of your ties, and you are capable of resolving these issues to your mutual satisfaction.
