The first and foremost thing that one needs to realize is that there is no universal definition of Love but in order to know the answer to this question you do need to have a definition of Love. How can you answer a question if you don't understand a critical piece of it? Then how do you proceed? Having realized this problem, the second thing then for everyone who is seriously looking for an answer to this question is to realize that the only way to proceed is by developing their own definition of love. Not something fuzzy but a very crisp definition which he/she can write down on a piece of paper. Which he/she can explain to others. If you can't put your understanding of love into words then it is unlikely that you have given it enough thought. While doing this exercise, be truthful to yourself. Whatever definition you create, always ask yourself - Would you like to live with a person who follows your definition of love? Lastly, having developed your definition of Love. You only have to check whether your feelings and actions towards the specific person are in sync with that definition. If so, then you are in love. REMEMBER: Your definition of love is your own. NEVER judge any other person's love by your definition of love because they might have a different definition. If you want to find out whether a person really loves you or not, just ask them their definition of love and then silently observe if their actions fit their definition. If they are not able to produce their own definition of love, then it is likely (but not certain) that they are only infatuated. If their actions do not match their definition, look harder. Since generally its unlikely to happen that way. We tend to misinterpret others actions according to our definition instead of theirs. Having taken that caution, if it still doesn't match, then that person needs to know about it. P.S. Initially I wanted to ignore answering this question because Love is a very subjective matter, but User's response to my comment to her answer begged a separate answer to this question. Love and Infatuation are two totally different feelings. Infatuation causes a lot of anxiety, Love shouldn't do that. Love is also quite different from being in a 'Loving relationship'. Love is a one way affair, a loving relationship is a two way affair. The one way relationship isn't too bad if your definition of love is based on giving rather then getting.

wen your in love all you can do is think about that person...everywhere you look something is always reminding you of them...no matter what they do you cant stay mad at them...u'll usually forgive anything they do no matter how stupid...all he/she has to do is give you a big hug and u feel like you're off the ground like nothing else matters...and you feel like you would do anything to see that person no matter the consequences. Ask yourself: 'Would I be willing to let her/him go if I believed it was the best thing?' Ask yourself: 'Am I willing to wait for this person if s/he is not ready to have sex?' Ask yourself: 'Would I feel the same way if s/he gained weight?' Ask yourself: 'Am I willing to sacrifice my dreams to allow her/his dreams to come true?' Ask yourself: 'Do I respect and admire her/him?' Ask yourself: 'Would I feel the same way if s/he got sick?' Ask yourself: 'If you two were in an argument, would you feel the same way?' If you answered 'No' to any of these questions, think about why you gave that answer. Is it a lack of trust? Is it because you're afraid? Is it selfishness? Do you need more time to get to know each other? If you answered 'Yes' to all of these questions, wow, you feel very strongly about this person. It sounds like you're in love! If you're wondering if you're in love, this is often because you might base a decision on your answer. Be careful! Decisions should not be based just on the feeling of 'love'. You should also look at respect, commitment and trust. Ask yourself what it means to you if you believe you're in love. Don't put pressure on yourself to define what you're feeling as love. And don't let anyone else pressure you either. If you're not sure of the answer right now. Give it some time and ask yourself these questions a few months or a year down the road. You might be surprised to see how your feelings change. 1. You can’t get enough cheesy love songs.I’m not saying that cheesy love songs don’t always have their place (I practically have Celine Dion’s entire catalog tattooed on my ribcage), but there is a point at which even the most bubblegum-ready songs become the New Theme Song of Your Life. To put it in perspective, I once found myself on the brink of actual human tears while listening to “Hey There, Delilah,” which I proceeded to put on repeat for the next 45 minutes. To be fair, I was 18 and facing down the prospect of a long-distance relationship. But still, this kind of unacceptable insanity is only excused for those in the heady throes of love. 2. You find any reason to bring them up.While there are going to undoubtedly be legitimate occasions to bring up your beloved, you might want to think about why your brain suddenly seems to make no distinction between “this incredible person I’m in love with” and “literally everything else on the planet.” If your roommate is wondering what you guys should make for dinner, and she suggests lasagna, and you’re like “Oh my god, so-and-so just has the cutest cat. He was totally crawling around the living room when we were making out and watching movies last night. So-and-so is such a good kisser. And has such a cute cat. You know, a cat. Like Garfield. Who is also a cat. The cat that loves lasagna. I’m sorry — we can eat whatever,” chances are you may be thinking of them more than would be considered normal. 3. Everything they do seems cute and endearing.There will come a time when your beloved’s habits might start to err towards the irritating side, depending on how disruptive and frequent they are. It’s only natural. But for now, though, enjoy thinking that everything they do is just perfect and adorable — from the way they don’t replace the toilet paper roll, to the way they take one single fork out of thedishwasher to use instead of emptying it, to the way they don’t cover their mouth when they cough. Scoop up all those precious germs, wouldn’t want to miss a drop of their intoxicating goodness. 4. You find yourself fantasizing about a life together.If, at a certain point while looking for a toothbrush holder at Bed, Bath and Beyond, you find yourself utterly paralyzed in front of a set of matching hand towels, overwhelmed with the thought of sharing a home with this person you can’t get enough of — you could very well be in love. If this fantasy extends to the kind of pet you’d like, what you would call your children, and the compulsion to write your married names all over a sheet of looseleaf — you are pressed like a fresh panini. Embrace it. 5. The only thing that matters is being with them. Not that there isn’t a lot to be said for intricate or adventurous outings, but one of the truer signs of love is the utter indifference towards what you are you actually doing, so long as you are with your dearest. The two of you, in fact, are more than content to spend an entire afternoon lying in bed naked, telling each other what you like about each other and generally being vomit-inducing to everyone who is not you. Outside of your little world, nothing exists — just remember to eat at least semi-regular meals in between all of your butterfly kisses. 6. You begin to retreat from society.It’s not that your friends aren’t awesome, because they totally are. It’s just that, for at least a few weeks, you are going to just fall off the face of the planet because nothing — not even President Obama riding up on a jet ski on a tidal wave of Corona ready to bring you to the beach party hosted by a naked Ryan Gosling — is as interesting or as engaging as being with your beloved. You’ll get back to them, it’s cool. 7. You are constantly denying being in love.It’s not that we don’t believe you, love, it’s just that, if your response to “Hey did you hang out with so-and-so this weekend?” is “WILL YOU SHUT THE HELL UP NANCY DREW I DON’T LOVE HIM OKAY GET OFF MY BACK JESUS,” welp… 8. All of a sudden, you’re a poet.There is an unspoken but universal law which states that any vaguely emotional blogging, Tweeting, status updating, or other forms of mass communication performed while in the heady throes of infatuation are not to be held against you. If you are up late one night and publish something along the lines of “You are the waves crashing against the sands of my beach, a depth of blue that seemed impossible to my parched skin,” it’s okay. We won’t judge. Just remember to make them private once you come to your senses. 9. You constantly feel like the words are going to slip out of your mouth.It’s an understandable fear that, at some uncertain point, you are going to see your beloved smile in a particular way while wiping a bit of ice cream from your lip while out at lunch and respond by literally exploding into a million pieces of confetti while screaming “I LOVE YOU.” We all know what that feels like. But it’s better to accept that it is how you feel and set to finding a good way to express this, rather than suppressing it like some volcano of terrifying levels of emotion, only to erupt at some unknown moment all over the both of you. 10. Everything seems unreasonably fun and happy.Have you ever noticed how beautiful flowers are? How about how cute little kis are? And that couple making out over there — good for them! They know what’s up! Oh, my god, let’s get some candy! Candy comes in so many beautiful, bright colors. Everything is just so perfect. It’s not too hot, not too cold. Let’s go for a walk. I don’t care where we go. Let’s just hang out. Or maybe we’ll cuddle under a blanket. I love blankets. Let’s knit a blanket with our initials in it. Oh, my god, an adorable old couple holding hands! DYINGGGGGG.  Source - 10 Signs You Are In Love

I am writing several points that I consider as signs of someone falling in love. So, these are entirely my points of view. According to me, if you can relate with the following signs, you are definitely in love: 1. When you see them, you realize that it is exactly the same face you have been searching for since eternity. 2. When you talk with them or think about talking with them, you begin to smile consciously or unconsciously for no reason. 3. You feel a unique form of pleasure which gives you butterflies in your stomach when you talk with them(in person or over text or call). 4. You feel your day is made if you talk with them. If you don't talk with them, you feel lonely and sad even though you are surrounded by other people. 5. You become deeply saddened or depressed if they say or do something hurtful, even though you are generally not bothered by life's trivia. 6. This person has become your weakness and you know it. However, you still seek a lot of strength from their presence in your life. 7. You don’t need the confirmation from others that you are in love with this person. You begin to feel deep inside that you really have fallen in love(even if you never have had a single crush in your entire life). 8. You are eager to know more and more about that person. You might begin to take interest even in things that they like which you never liked earlier). 9. You want to spend most of your time with that particular person and it feels like heaven when you are with them. 10. You can miss them all the time, 24x7. 11. At times, when you feel very nostalgic or miss your childhood, thinking about or talking with the person gives you a lot of relief and instantly changes your mood. 12. You consider yourself lucky and fortunate to have them in your life. You consider their presence in your life as a God’s miracle. 13. You can listen to love songs all the time and never get bored(even though you never liked to listen love songs much). You can relate with each and every love song in the world since the day you met them. 14. You may find yourself singing love songs when you think about them. 15. You actually wish you had met them earlier in your life so that that phase of the life before you met them would be as joyful as it is after you met with them. 16. You love to surprise them with gifts and don't feel like your money gets wasted if you spend it on them, even in large amounts. 17. You will feel jealous or sad if some other person flirts with them with especially with better credentials or looks. However, you are ready to sacrifice them for their happiness if they also like that other person. 18. You will always cherish and never regret falling in love with them even though they hurt you. You might just say- “he/she was the best mistake I ever made”. In short, your heart continues to shower love on them despite the hatred for them in your mind(for their wrongdoing). 19. You would want to express to them directly or indirectly that you love them to see their reaction, feel lighter or expect a relationship from them. 20. You want others i.e. your friends and family members know this person and how much they mean to you. You feel proud to have this person in your life no matter what. 21. You are always ready to fight for this person verbally or physically with anybody who is causing them any kind of distress. 22. When you are with them, you unconsciously don't like to use your mobile at that time. You always want to give them upmost attention. 23. You respect them, their feelings and opinions. You hardly ever contradict them, not just because you don't want to ruin your impression in front of them but also because your heart doesn't allow you to contradict them. 24. You will care about this person to the extent that you daily give them some piece of information that might be useful for them in present or future. It can be anything like a useful tip or technique related to something. 25. You tell them your secrets that you generally don't share with anyone. You have a lot of faith and trust in them. You might also call them your “true friend or best friend”. 26. Even though it has been just a month or so since you have met them, a voice in your head tells you that your feelings for them won't end easily or will last for several years now. In fact, they really do last for several years. 29. You are not infatuated towards them and you know it. You consider physical intimacy as secondary. The primary thing or priority will be their presence in your life that you admire the most. 30. If you are good at something like writing, you will write poems or songs for them but not specifically to show them. You just cherish the pleasure you seek during the process. Thank you for reading! I hope you have a wonderful day ahead. :)

It's one of the most common questions that leads people to Google their way to my work: How do I know if I'm in love? Sometimes, people even find themselves asking, How do I know if I'm in love ... enough? Odds are, if you've taken a minute to ask yourself this question, you might have come up with some answers like these: I'll know when I'm in love because I'll feel it.Love is a feeling.You just know.I feel alive and thrilled with I'm in love.When I'm in love, I always want to see my partner. I miss him/her when s/he is away.When I'm in love, I'm never bored.But the truth is that none of these answers describes real love. They describe infatuation. Infatuation is defined by a feeling whereas real love is defined by action. In fact, what we tend to refer to as being "in love" is essentially selfish. It's an attempt to measure love by how the other person makes you feel, instead of by tangible actions on your part that require you to give and show up for the commitment of loving. Western culture upholds the feeling of love as a godlike realm and the gauge by which we measure the "rightness" of a relationship. How we set ourselves up for failure with this definition of love, for anyone who has spent time exploring the inner realms knows that feelings fade. Feelings are fickle. Feelings are not a reliable yardstick for determining the sustainability of an intimate relationship. So what is real love? Real love, first and foremost, extends from a place of fullness inside oneself.Real love is giving.Real love is connection.Real love is friendship.Real love includes a genuine desire to learn about yourself and grow with each other.Real love will push you to your edge around areas like intimacy, sexuality, attraction, time, money, anger, and control.Real love assumes a position of responsibility about these issues, which means that you recognize them as originating inside of you and, as such, own that they would emerge in some form with any partner.Real love takes time to learn about and nurture.One of the most damaging beliefs in our culture is that you should know if you're in love right from the beginning. The truth is that it can take many years to learn about real love, and the more you fall in love with your own life and can connect with a reliable source of creativity and connection, the more you can give and receive love in a healthy way.

You  will think that that person likes him/her too.2. Observe whether you find yourself thinking about them when they're not around. You want to know everything about them and their ways from all angles.You want to talk about them to your friends.You include them in your prayers.You miss them all the time.You're lonely without them, you can't appreciate the things around  you even if you're in the best place in the world. Your world seems  empty without them.You can't get them out of your mind.You kept thinking what they're doing right now.You get that funny feeling in your stomach when you think about him or her.You keep having visions you kissing them or hugging and holding hands.Think about the quality of the time you spend together. You spend as much time as possible with him/her, and don't want to be apart.You talk to them continually, share your ideas and your enjoyable times and events together.When you're with them you have no other doubts of who you want to be with or where you want to be, because right there.You'll treasure a gift that he or she has given to you, even a very small gift.Figure out whether you think about a future with this person.You want to introduce them to everyone and to show them what you have found and are developing together.You want to know his/her family. The names of his/her brothers and sisters and parents.You always think that your name and his/her name sounds perfect together.These are all the kinda feeling we come through when we fell in love.. But still to say frankly there is much more silly things to mention when comes as "Symptoms for Love" which i have heard from my close buddies :)

That's hard to say, and I hardly think I'm an expert. I will tell you the symptoms I am experiencing now that I am in what I think is love.  There is no person on this planet I trust more than her, and I do so because she has earned it many times over.I am terrified of her getting hurt.I am the happiest I have ever been when she is around.I sleep better when she is there, and I am happier on mornings when I wake up next to her.I delight in seeing her smile and I feel good when she is happy, especially when I've helped make her happy.I miss her when she isn't around.I have promised myself and her that when we have problems (and we do), we will address them together and become closer because of them. I do not use them as justifications for breaking up and I do not leave her.I am fond of the idea of spending the rest of my life with this person.My monogamy with her is natural. Yes, I have committed to her and have promised not to sleep with anyone else. But even if we did not have such a commitment - I don't want to sleep with anyone else. That doesn't mean I'm not attracted to anyone else, but I would just rather spend the time with her.Differences between love and infatuation, since they share some of the above symptoms.  The feelings are reciprocated.I have a lot of previous dating experience.If we were to break up, while I would be terribly hurt, I would be capable of taking care of myself in every way. When I was infatuated in the past, losing the girl's attention would have meant losing my purpose in life.I do not look to her to give me validation, and I do not view the fact that I am in a relationship with her as a source of validation.I do not feel like she is exploiting my feelings for her. She gives me as much attention and affection as I give her. She has never hurt me or used my feelings for her as a tool to manipulate me.I do not avoid difficult problems in order to preserve the relationship. I know the relationship will be preserved because we face difficult problems together.Thanks for the A2A Diniel.

This is my new favorite subject of wisdom, awareness, healing…and ecstatic days ahead. (Hope) Let us be ‘in love’ with the air we breathe, the water we drink, the land which feeds us, the animals who share our world, our precious self…and each other. In order to answer this question with anything other than old worn-out and wisdom demolishing assumptions and bs..we have to define what we are calling..’ In Love’. We are a trinity…as many of us have heard in some way or the other. A body (vessel for experiencing), A mind (operating system), and of course, to allow it all to get up and move (Heart)…universal energy animating, connection, and adding consciousness to experiences or, in other words, …life, God…or my favorite..Love. I have read studies where they have found out our heart actually ‘registers thoughts and divine emotions. So if you hear your..”still small voice’ the one who loves and somehow is found, in many cases, all-knowing, intuitive, and downright magic, realize you are connected through your heart..and not your computer system provided to navigate this world of separation. Being ‘in love’ is about the true flowing together in this essential love energy.. no one is stopping the flow, there is no need…they are in love. Ever wonder if a tree is conscious? A flower? Do they simply grow and die without ever knowing they lived and made me smile..or feel comforted when I was alone..strong and steady standing there for me..also appearing to be alone, stuck..forgotten, powerless…truly unseen and empty of the ability to love? Be conscious of the fact that a tree breathes what would harm us, then gifts all the whole earth's life-sustaining oxygen…shades us, houses us, feeds us, burns to warm us, allows us to grow and breathe while standing steady or reclining beneath..is this not love in its most perfect defining? So the tree loves me..and I know it..if I find a second to notice it does..the reason is..it adds to the allowing of my essential energy which makes me conscious..alive..seen..known, welcome and connected. Its being..increases mine * fulfillment, joy, peace and the ability to love myself and others through truth and awareness with no motives but for all to live ecstatic…because of the walk…’in love’ or we could say… the exhilarating ride of life that we are alive only to experience..not for some cruel and unfair tests..but for this..to experience and contribute to love. Intentions have also been proven to change molecular patterns in water causing chaos and what appears to be destroying one another amongst the molecules or beautiful..symetrical, and harmonious flowing patterns. If we are aware of love in the consciousness of all life..then we will have the same intentions towards that life..we will stand in front of a flower or tree..or little animal..or each other..and add more and more of the love energy..we have noticed from them…where there is two or more..there I AM..flowing joy, life, health, peace, power, allowance…which is all..love. Get in that flow..you know it? What is heartache? I believe our heart aches when our essential flow of consciousness of love is blocked, slammed shut..not allowed, devalued or ignored. Hope seems so far and unavailable, joy can’t even be remembered..and pain becomes life. When we feel loved and seen, this energy is easily allowed to flow freely..and we feel amazing. (because our heart energy is flowing..connecting to life) Obviously, for most people, this experience is best felt, enjoyed, increased and maintained, expanded through this essential connection with another person..a lover. You can get there with the tree..but way more intense with another speaking, touching, free-willed being. Before we can be in love.. we have to open the flow up. Our flow of love energy is often shut by fears, anxieties, traumas, false beliefs, cruel self-talk, judgments about self and the world not being enough…and these are all secretly and overtly painful, not because they are truth, but because they block the flow of truth, life..and love. Once we can open our hearts to ourselves, we then can and will want to so much..open our hearts to another. When those two love energies are allowed and flowing…the two are in love. When one closes up their flow..with judgments or fears..we call this the work of ‘baggage’. And it is…it takes us out of that flow of love..elation..ecstasy of being known and allowed..just where we are suppose to be and throws us back into fear. This happens often in relationships when the two are not self-aware and self-fulfilling but depend only on the other to keep the previously closed flow of love energy moving..and at first, it's all roses and floating… but that wears off..because there is no foundation except the other person. The other person can not be responsible to keep you full…only to enjoy and enter with you..into your fullness..with theirs. And, as I have already written here.. where there is two or more..there I AM. Be in love with your own energy and flow of light..but first, you need to notice it. THEN you will notice this same flowing energy in another (a connection which can last a whole lifetime and maybe beyond)..and connection can be so easy..flowing. Welcome to being in love… Warning.. you may feel like you are in love easily if someone validates your beauty, encouraging your heart to open and allow some flowing… when you rarely or never do. But this never lasts…you are vulnerable to increased heartache when the validations don’t come regularly from the other, because you can not or will not validate self (you can not get your worth because of the opinions or actions of others..this is not love…but illusion)...you will start to shut down because of fears and judgments. Once the fears and judgments come in..the flow of joy and peace..fulfillment stops and the suffering starts right back up again. Can those in love…scream and hurt one another over illusions of what is real and important? Self-love, validation, and awareness..are where we start our journey into love..into the arms of one who opens and allows and increases all that we are..as we do the same for them. Signs that we are ‘flowing together in love”? Where there is love… there are no judgments, lies, hiding, or fear. Where there are fear and judgment..there is no opening for love. Where there is love…there are no limitations.. Be in love with yourself…open your heart to your own beauty, worth and love…so it will be open to another’s, and close your mind to all your judgments..be your greatest lover..and another will come who is open the same..and both will fall…right in..flowing in ecstatic love energy and life..together..whole and always increasing for each other and all life. Sound like utopia?..well good, I meant to do that! Blessings and Truth.. -Leann

Here are some points to know you might be falling in love :) When he comes in front of you or his name blink on your phone you’ll smile automatically and feeling happier.Thoughts of him comes in your mind frequently and randomly.You start blushing when someone take his name or asking/talking about him to you.You notice small details about him that others can’t. I mean a little small change too.You become addicted to him. If you don’t talk to him once, you’ll feel like day is incomplete or something missing.You enjoy reading all conversation repeatedly that you had with him and smile when you are alone. :)His mood literally affects on yours. You can feel a breeze of love once in a while with some person when you two fall in sync. However, being in love is like falling in love with the same person over and over again for multiple reasons and sometimes for no reasons at all. Here are some reasons on top of my mind (sorry for being cheesy): 1. When you wake up and you see that person and you fall in love with her again. And this starts to happen everyday. 2. When you think of something funny and you can't wait to share as you know that you will fall again for her when she is laughing. 3. When she is the best cook (after your Mom) and you are a foodie. And whenever she cooks something you fall for her one more time. 4. When you see how smart she is, when she is all independent and doesn't need you for all the small things in life. Still she will call you in kitchen to open a tight bottle sometime and give you a peck for being so strong(physically). 5. When you can't get over the fact that you are the LUCKIEST person out there. 6. When you are talking to some friends or you are in a meeting and suddenly you think about her and suddenly there's a broad smile and some blush on your flush. Other people might think that you have lost it completely but you know that there's this permanent happiness in your life. 7. When you can be you, a baby, a jealous person, cheesy, a PJ cracker and all those ugly and bad things which you think would drive a girl away but still she loves you from all her heart then you can't help it. If someone accepts you for what you are with all your faults you can not  not fall in love with her.  8. When you stop enjoying movies alone as you will miss your partner for even the slightest of romance is displayed on screen. 9. When you start writing a list in this answer and then so many points keep coming and you start missing her again. 10. When you can relate to depiction of love in poetry, movies, songs and philosophy. These songs won't feel absurd anymore. You start understanding why these people have not gone out of business from centuries. There are so many more things which can be listed. There is no sign from the universe that you are in love. You have to notice those small small things yourself. I will tell you one thing that when you are in love you will come to know that you are in love because there's this feeling which you would have never experienced in life before. A complete stranger becomes so close in such less time, it's a miracle and nothing less. I hope and pray that everyone finds love one day and be as happy everyday as I am and this world will be such a beautiful place!

Cheers!

Take a little break.When you’re with other people, split up and mingle. Try your best to stay engaged in the conversation. If you find yourself zoning out and looking around for your crush, the potential for love is there. If you catch them stealing a glance at you, the feeling might be mutual. 2 .Note your physical reactions. Consider involuntary responses when you’re around your crush. Look out for rapid heart rate, hot flashes, shaky hands, and sweaty palms. Notice whether you suddenly clam up out of fear of what to say. Reactions like these signal lust and infatuation, not love. 3. Evaluate your generosity. Consider how often you share your possessions with this person (or how prepared you are to do so). Imagine they want to borrow that rare vinyl album you just bought at auction. If you share or are willing to share, it could be love. 4. Consider how often do you make sacrifices This doesn’t mean giving up your career plans or letting your crush take advantage of you. It does mean giving a little to brighten their day. Think about the last time this person was sick. If you canceled your weekend binge-watching to take care of them, you could be in love. On the other hand, if your first reaction was to complain, it’s infatuation at best. 5. Pay attention to mirroring Love makes you feel comfortable. In relaxed situations, you’re likely to imitate the other person’s actions, even if you’re not aware of it. Make a mental note if you catch yourself taking a sip of coffee almost at the exact same time they do. It’s not a surefire sign of love, but it increases the likelihood. 6. Evaluate your responses to their success This is especially important when your crush succeeds at something you’ve failed at. For example, they were awarded the promotion you were vying for. If your first reaction is to throw a party, you’re likely in love. On the other hand, if you mumble a disappointed “That’s nice” and avoid them the rest of the day, it’s just infatuation. 7. Consider your larger social circle Think about the number of friends and family members you’ve introduced this person to (or want to introduce them to). Ask yourself how important it is that they like this person. If you’ve introduced them to your best friend(s) and closest family members, and if you really want them to like this person, you could be in love. “May God help you to find your true love friends” ( If you are reading my answer for the first time, you may also follow me for my other answers, hope to see you soon again, till then Chao! )

Love is a series of choices. The first choice is based on many many factors, including chemistry, principles, logic, humor, intelligence, body type, where we are in our lives, what we want/need… the list goes on and on, and the weight of each factor varies depending on the individual. Based on these factors, we either choose to begin the process to love or not. If we decide to enter this process, the action of loving can bring “light switch” moments. The way he looks at you. How hard she makes you laugh. The notes he hides in your purse. The way she makes you feel when you don’t feel anything. But like an airplane flight, there is turbulence. The fights. The disagreements. The little things that bother you. His socks. Her shopping. You start wondering if you’ve made the right choice. Once you are in doubt, you have to make another choice: to continue to fly with this person or jump out of the plane. This choice is based on a thousand other factors, again depending on the individual and where they are in their journey. If you decide to jump, the scary free fall will either make you stronger (grow) or miserable (depressed), depending on whether you see your expiration as a rebirth or a death. But sooner or later, you’ll find yourself back at the airport waiting to board another plane. Then you hit turbulence. Or maybe there is no turbulence. Maybe you’ve changed your mind about the destination. Either way, another choice. Fly or jump? Love is making a choice every single day, to either love or not love. That’s it. It’s that simple. Either to continue the process or not. We fall in and out of love when we’re in relationships. Read that again. Because people think if we’re not head over heels for someone, we shouldn’t be with them. Our feelings fluctuate, depending on the relationship but also how happy we are in our own lives. And yes there is drift and if you drift so far that you don’t know or like yourself anymore, maybe it is time to jump. Just know that there is a difference between feeling love for someone (caring about a person) and loving someone (choosing to love that person). You may have love for someone forever. But that doesn’t mean you choose to love that person forever. The choice to love is not a feeling; it is an action. That is why it is so difficult. It requires you to do something, and I’m not just talking about buying flowers. It might mean putting your wants aside. Also, like chemistry, the ability to love is not a constant. It is a variable. It fluctuates, depending on where you’re at in your life and what you’re struggling with. Sometimes it is easy to love. Sometimes it is extremely difficult. But at the end of the day, it’s always a choice. Keep loving folks :)

A2A The following signs are enough to know whether you are in love or not - He becomes your habit. If you don't talk to him for one day, just one day - it feels as if something is missing from your life!You can't imagine your life without him. All the small/big decisions 'first' involve him, and then something else.You can't resist yourself from involving him in even your smallest decisions. His opinion becomes a necessity!You cry at the slightest sight of him being hurt. He tells you that punched someone and broke his hand - it's you who cry while he enjoys!He becomes more like your family. You want to tell your family about him, and if you can't tell them, you tell your cousins, or people who can keep your secret!Talking about 'him' is fun. You can talk about him all day, every second. You never get bored of it.You see his family, as your family, and you care for them like you would care for your family members.You can't see him upset. Even a change in his voice tone disturbs you and you kick everything aside just to attend him.He becomes the priority! No matter what you are doing, whether it's an exam preparation or you are in a meeting with the President - if he needs you and it's an emergency, you will 'willingly' give him your attention! It's not like you have to, it's like - you will. Involuntarily, without thinking - you will.His birthday is the most important day of the year! You plan your entire year around it, so that you are free that day and can do something special for him. If you are in long distance, you 'try to' plan a surprise so big that he remembers it for months! :)His important days are your important days. If he has an interview - you will be equally, hell even more nervous! If he has an exam, it's you who will be restless. If he falls sick, it's you who will worry more than him.He is more important than yourself. Suppose you both have exams on the same day - if you love him, you will make sure he studies well, and if he's careless about it, you study his subjects, make notes, parcel them to his city, so that he can study and pass - while you are also preparing for your subjects side by side! Phew. I used to send him notes of subjects like VLSI, Micro-controllers etc back when he was in Chandigarh. I might graduate as a Computer engineer this year, but I have also studied around 50% Electronics along with him :p While sending him notes, I used to add random stick notes on top of important chapters, reminding him to study them more attentively. And on his last exam day, he did this - (Clicked on 21st December, 2014 - last exam of his engineering degree!) Yes, that's a very blurry picture, but I wrote "All the BEST. I Love You..." on the note, and he wrote - "I LOVE YOU TOOOO" and sent me the picture of the stick note. And since that day, I concluded one thing - this man can't click a photo properly!

This is another way of saying you don’t know right now. You just met the girl. You’re having sex. You love her unique smile – unique from every other smile you’ve ever been given. She gets you to do things you never thought about doing before. She gets you to laugh. She gets you to daydream about what life would be like with her, and you hate the thought of life without her. I get it. We’ve all been there. Done that. And then it doesn’t work out. That’s okay. Most things don’t work out. But we're not in tomorrow. Always ask yourself: What am I going to do today. Today is the only day that matters. So ask this today and be honest:  Do you want the same thing out of 	a relationship (presumably, if you love her, you want a long-term 	committed relationship) Do you both have similar values 	about friendships, places you want to live, luxuries you want to 	have (or not) Do you like the way she treats you 	and is sensitive to what you want?Ask these questions every day. If the answer comes up “no” then talk about it with her why. Being with someone forever (getting married) means you want to spend 50 years with a person. That’s never happened before in history but its happening now because of longer life spans.  So you need to ask those questions every day. And for that day, and that day only, you know. [Note: I answer this and similar questions in http://www.jamesaltucher.com/category/askjames/]]

It is a very common question, "How can I tell I'm in love?", but it is not an easy question to answer. What feels like love to one person may be nothing more than attraction to another. Some people fall in and out of love quickly and often while others are never really in love as much as they are in lust. This can get confusing when you are a teen because romantic love is a relatively new concept for you and you don't know what to expect. You are overwhelmed with all sorts of new feelings and social pressures. They are confusing. When you are in love, you are sort of paranoid when the person comes around. When you see them, you are trying to make yourself more to something that you know they'll like, even if it means pretending to be a person that doesn't know who they really are. When you are in love, you can't describe your feelings and you feel so blind because love removes all the pain you feel. When you come across your crush, you feel like you are melting and as if you are going to faint. Sometimes, when you feel that you want to faint, you try and play around that you fainted, just to fall into his/her arms. When someone says "Love is blind, as far as the eye can see", it's best to believe it. You know you are in love when you see them and you go tingly and warm. You know when you are into space. When you are in love (been there).....well, when you first start going out you are all nervous to see them....but then after a couple of months you don't get nervous any more but you still feel this giggly feeling...you feel like you are floating and you are sooo happy and you want to spend so much time with this person it's great...but take it slowly, others aren't always as ready as you are for love. You know you're in love when all you can do is think about them day and night...when all you can do is fear of losing them, someone else replacing you...you find them to be the most beautiful person whom ever existed...Everything they do is right in your eyes and they can do no wrong.. That person makes you feel special and you want to be with them 24/7...Its more of an emotional connection..That person makes you want to be a better person...you do things for them you never did to anyone else before..you just know you're in love (a feeling)..When you find the love of your life time stops with everything else and he/she is the only thing that moves... You never know when you are in love unless you meet the following 3 criteria: The love is unconditional.The love is forever.The love must be in both of you. I think Love is when you hear his/her voice you melt. When you look at there eyes and you notice the color for the first time, and its the most beautiful thing you have ever seen. when you run to them with any issue you may have and you KNOW that they will do all in there power to save you as best they can, even if its something small. and they love you for just the way you are, they love every little weird face and silly laugh you have to offer. That to me is perfect love You know you are in love when all you can think about is that special person. When you haven't talked in awhile, anywhere from ten minutes to ten days, do you long for his/her voice? .. Edit: If you want to meet your soulmate or the best singles, you can free join our elite club for singles. Giving yourself a chance to meet a better person, just try, Meeting your love and here’s the most authentic user experience….Good luck.

This is how James Altucher explains it, I can't do better than that.  Love is: --Love is when you have no demands on the other person. Not even to make you happy. --Love is when you care what they do, but don't worry about what they are doing.  --Love is when they say or do something insignificant and you feel, "SURPRISE!"  --Love is when you miss them, but don't require them. --Love is when they are right all the time, even when they are wrong. You might be wrong. Who knows? --Love is when you love the other people who love them. --Love is when you see who they are. Not when you see who you want them to be. --Love is when you're afraid to lose them, but you don't try and "keep" them. --When there's drama, Love is when you both wrote the script together.  --Love is when they are upset and tell you and you count to two before you respond, "You're right". --You love them when you keep yourself clean and you sleep well and eat well. --Love is when you forgot to tell them something... all the time. --Love is when you can't sleep and are feeling sick and anxious and its  3am, but you reach out and touch them and now you are feeling a little  better. --SURPRISE!  --Love is when they are sick and there's nothing you can do so you listen to them. --Love is when they want to do something and you don't, so you don't and everyone feels good about it. --Love is when you just think "laugh", and they start to laugh. --You love them when you can still love yourself. This isn't a list of what you SHOULD do when you are in love. If you feel "should" then you might not be in love. These are things I feel when I'm in love. Love comes and goes. And  comes and goes. It's ok to not be in love. And it's okay to be in love  forever.

Putting aside family, as we grow up with them and love our parents and siblings for obvious reasons, if we want to know if we love someone, these are the sure things that happen in most of the cases. You wake up with his thoughts and go to sleep with him in your mind. The first thought in the morning and last thought in the night will be about him.You make yourself available for them all the time.You will never have enough of them, no matter how much ever time you talk, text or spend together, you always wish for some more.You place them above all your priorities. In fact they take the topmost place in your priority list.You can’t stand if anyone says even a word against him and that makes you furious and even dislike the latter.No matter how many ever compliment you, a compliment from him makes your day.Million jokes might fail to cheer you up, but a mere sight of him cheers you up.You are always in the process of making new plans to surprise him.Your days seems to be incomplete if you don’t talk to him at least once.The presence of him brings a million dollar smile on your face.When it comes to his problems or needs, you attend them first even if you have an exam the next day.When your phone beeps, you blush at the sight of his name on the screen(be it a text or a phone call).Amidst a bunch of people, your eyes always search for him and never fail to notice him with in seconds.Even a little thing that he does for you, makes you the happiest and you will be on cloud nine.You know that he is not perfect, but it doesn’t matter to you and you are perfectly okay with it.When you fight with him, all that you think about is the best times that you had with him.You miss him the very next minute, right after being with him for the whole day.He is the only one who can make you very happy and can also hurt you the most at the same time. You are ready to go to any extent to fight for him, and you don’t care what other people think about him.Even if you are deeply hurt and angry with them for what they have done, you love them so much that you can’t shout at them as you don’t want them to get hurt in return.Even a mere thought of losing him makes your heart beat fast and you feel skipping a heart beat is much better than losing him or forgetting him.

“How do you know if you truly love someone?” The feeling is more than surface, it is lasting, it grows. It isn't just physical, the chemistry is also spiritual, intellectual. You find yourself letting the walls down, allowing them to get closer than you've allowed anyone else to. You value their input, you want their "voice" in your life. You find yourself wanting to simply see them smile, know that they are safe, you make time for them because you honestly care about how their day went. You'd move heaven and earth to protect them. You offer your strength when they are hurting. You'd fly around the world to give them a hug. You'd pull them back from the edge when they feel like everything is lost. You pick up the phone and write silly messages just to make them laugh, because it's like holding a diamond in your hand when they do. Their dreams, their passion, seeing them succeed becomes your happiness too. You place them first. You can't wait to hear their stories, learn from their experiences. You suddenly find that no one else will do. You find yourself wanting the things that you never thought you would. They become the exception to every rule your heart ever made.  (No copyright infringement intended)

Three years ago- I would never step into the kitchen, even unaware of where Mumma used to keep the cups. Mom- Beta, peel these potatoes for me? Roma (if “eww” had a face)- My fingers would turn black. I won’t. Ask Bhaiya to help you out.  Mom- Beta, I want to rest. Can you chop the onions by then? Roma- Onions? Never. I just can’t stand the smell. Ask Bhaiya.  Scene- On a video call with “Him” He was taking some medicine. Roma- What happened bae? He- Nothing. Stomach upset. Roma- Must have been chomping on huge truck of junk. Why do you do this? He- Cause I love food okay.  Roma stormed into the kitchen, the very next day. Since then, over the span of three months, I managed to cook at home what he eats out- Yes! I did that! (Do not pay attention to the presentation, I just clicked to have a check) A basic chocolate cake- A basic vegetable pizza- Shahi Paneer Roasted Paneer- Fried momos (I was a novice, excuse the weird shape) Paneer cheeseballs A lot of Chicken New Year’s cake- I learnt to chop vegetables, including onion-  I know, they’re enough of not-so-well-presented food in shiny cutleries and mint and basil here and there, but hey, I did this out of love. Doesn’t that count? I had always been a 10 to 6 sleep-person. I am now a 3 to 8 sleep-person. Late night video calls, distance relationship, you see?I never am pissed off, for he forgot my birthday (which he never did by the way), but over the fact, he slept for only 2 hours, when he knows, he needs 7 hours of it.My calendar is full of red crosses, counting back days when I’m going to meet him next.My gallery is full of screenshots of him sleeping, eating, applying an ointment, arguing, combing hair, making all the faces in the world.Going to a public space while him being in the town, makes my mind go crazy on what if we bump into each other?I used to hate recording my voice. And here I am, singing him to sleep now, or maybe when he gets all upset.I had been infatuated for 4 years, until I confessed. Since then, I have always been in love. Every day, every hour, every moment since then.

Your limbs turn to jelly and thinking of anything other than what ishappening now is impossible.  When you look into each others eyes the recognition is there that says yes to anything  that might happen and  hope that it does. The music in your head is like no other boys band or  symphonics  heard.    Each sound is an echo of your beloved's  breath is that a pant?  Your heart like a hammer  Hold me, kiss  me, the pleasure flows through  the lovers growing  in intensity to  crescendos and spirited spasms then hot lava, unstoppable, escaping from secret places urgent, spurting bubbling white scent until a single tear signals that they are come to a resting point which is damp on limp curls of black and gold. And rest after they come, to the end they beg not to.  inevitably  they must   sleep and are carried lashed  on the fluttering wings of black birds and brown sparrows  while  lovers sleep restless and dream of the morn-lovely exhaustion.  Above the moon moves in  orbit a black and white cat ponders, the stars rush the night treetops - points of light black skies beacon, there the moon awakened trails,  its spells carried on strands of light awakens them and looking at one another they are 2 lovers again wrestling as one.  Their new acquired taste for tawdry rose petals luscious  virgin apples coupled with blood, miniature bites on shivering skin of ebony or pearls.  The wine mocks through its glass unfolding paintings of red nipples and baying  hounds at fresh scent,  masters seated on magnificent dappled  and brown mounts,  snorting at hounds too close the pitched sound of the horn baying across meadows tells all the hunt has begun.
