Like I am not an expert but I think some of the circumstances that may be an indication that you kind of “in love” with that person is You’ll do anything to make them laughYou will feel a little shy whenever you’re around themYou’ll start connecting with romantic songsYou'll always be ready to travel those extra miles for themYou’ll try to grab every single possible opportunity to interact with themYou”ll be always there for themYou’ll do anything to put a smile on that faceA cute text from them is enough to make you blush so hard that your cheeks turn redYou’ll start reading their text again and againYou put some extra efforts to keep the conversation going, to make them laugh, to do something that will make them happy.You start creating your own imaginary conversation with them in your mindApart from them, No one’s attention excites you anymoreYour wildest dream now only consists of having a dinner or watching a movie with themYou start adopting their taste and preferencesYou feel happy around themYou’ll genuinely feel sad when you will come to know that they are sad due to any reasonTheir activities will start affecting youYou’ll be always concerned about themAnd most importantly, like that's the golden advantage of falling in love .You will always try to improve yourself, in every possible aspect just for her And last but not the least You are just thinking about her/him while reading this answer I know that was a very dramatic answer from a non-emotional person but that's all i have Peace

The moment you know that you are in love with someone is one of the most exciting and terrifying moments in existence. Falling in love with someone is scary because, for the most part, it is completely out of your control. The heart wants what the heart wants. When the elation, the nerves, the butterflies, the anxiety, and the euphoria all come together, somehow you just know.  When you are in love certain things tends to happen like - When time goes by in fast forward and you desperately wish there was a pause button on life so you could be with them forever, frozen in a perfect moment.When you forget you’re hungry and all you can think about is how amazing the other person is and when you wake up and the other person is the first thing that crosses your mind and the thought of them immediately makes you smile :-) When you are on text then how suddenly the time of about 4 to 5 hours at night goes you didn't realise. And you always feel good after talking no matter you feel sleepy or not but at that moment you just feel that this talks never stop :)When you trust them enough to tell them and share your deepest, darkest secret, and you know they won’t run away. You feel comfortable enough to be at your most vulnerable, and you know they will try and protect you from your demons and fears. When all you want to talk about is the person you’re falling for. How sweet they are. How caring they are. How similar you two are. You want to tell the world everything about them and inform everyone especially your freinds about the story how you two first met.All of these things can be signs, but the moment you realize you actually love the other person, you just know. It hits you like a ton of bricks. It knocks the air out of your lungs and you feel amazing :) Keep smiling :)

Hi Ravishankar. And thanks for the A2A. Well, you know - you'll probably hear the same answer from many people who have been in a longer-term relationship. It's kind of difficult to imagine if you haven't experienced it yet. But they will all smile and say "Oh - you'll know!" It's true up to an extent. The problem can be that there may be cultural variations which complicate things. In the US, everyone makes such a big deal out of "dating". To a European (or maybe just to me), this whole dating thing is a bit of a puzzle. In Europe, things aren't so complicated. "Well, yeah, we hang out a lot together and have sex, but he's not by bf..." Weird. I don't know. But I'm old. So what do I know? But back to your question. If your brain melts when you see him or her. If your pulse goes all staccato, if you simply can't help grinning like a fool wherever they are near, if the way they smell makes you dizzy... chances are that you are in love. (Or a bit drunk, perhaps). If you like a guy or a girl fine, but don't feel like your head is going to fly up into the sky and explode like a big firework, then you like him / her, but you aren't in love. Let me add something, if I may, in the hope that it will help you avoid grief in future: Being "in love" never lasts. Once the first three months are over at the latest, reality catches up with you. You will have had your first arguments. You will have seen one another with your early morning "oh my god, is it Monday already? I feel like I haven't slept a minute and I have a headache" face. You will start to miss the feeling of excitement when he or she is coming to visit. It'll become more everyday. this is when many people break up because they are disappointed. This is sad, because they are starting to see the real person behind the pretty, always happy and smiling mask of their new partner. The big difference between being in love and loving somebody is that you cannot love somebody you don't really know. You know, people expect rainbows and sparkly feeling to last and when they fade, they think they have failed. Wrong. They are starting to see the real person - and not the person they think their new partner is. Things start to get more honest. Each partner sees that the other has good days and bad days. Love grows from this understanding of your partner, of knowing this person with time almost as well as knowing yourself. And wanting to be with this person. Of being stronger as a couple than as single people. Of being a team. Of trusting one another implicitly. Of feeling that the worst day has just become better, just because you are together again. Of respecting and genuinely liking your partner and not wanting to be with anyone else. Of knowing what makes them laugh, what their favourite food is and how you can cheer them up when they are down. And this feeling - this feeling can also fade, but often lasts on and on. I have met old couples - over ninety, who hold hands and are simply happy to be together.  So there's hope for us all! All the best.

Your actions says it all. The love makes us do unbelievable things in the end right? Well, it was morning 7. He was never a morning person or a early bird. But his inner urge to have a small talk with her made him do it. He was checking her last seen status in whatsapp. 6.15 AM- last seen today at 1:05 AM. 6.35 AM- last seen today at 1:05 AM. 7.05 AM - last seen today at 1:05 AM. 7.21 AM - last seen today at 1:05 AM. Finally after waiting for almost 2 hours, her last seen changed to online 8.02 AM- Online. & it was now the time for his brain to make some ways to have that talk. Brain : let's put up a status in whatsapp so that she can know that we're online. Heart: No, no. It's too risky. She will know it. What will she think of us then? Brain :ahh you coward! Let's forward her a message. Wait, let me check some good morning messages in the internet. Heart: don't you think that will look like a bit cheesy? Brain(angrily) : do you want to talk to her? Heart: :-( Brain : Let's do a thing, we can put a message in that group where she is a member as well. Heart: Yesssssss, let's do this. What he did then? He did put up a message in the group & was constantly checking message info to check if she did see that message. Then? He then started to read their previous conversations for the umpteenth time. Well Well, if you did wait for someone like this then you're in love. If you're mind & heart had this types of conversations then definitely you're in love. The time you're talking with that person ; if you want that time to get freezed then you're definitely in love. That's butterflies in stomach, that goosebumps, that urge ; these all are part & parcel of the feeling called love. POST CREDIT SCENES: After much struggle, he sends her a joke. For which, she replies `so funny!! :D `. He then reads this message several times & decides to focus his career on becoming a comedian . However a flying chappal from mom was enough give him some brains. :D

YOU DON’T FIND LOVE, LOVE FINDS YOU. And after that its your CHOICE that you provide it a haven in your heart or not. I believe true love happens unkowingly, it is not something which can be planned and fabricated. Before you read further, think about your loved one so as to savour the depth of the words. It is true love when what matters to you is the heart of that person. Looks, money , status , some personality traits or good qualities are secondary and play a vital role in the beginning and sustenance of a relationship. Naturally interests, mentality, behaviour, sanity and such things carry a lot of importance but what pulls you towards that person is their inner self.Love is when you don’t let GIVING UP be an option in your relationship even after fights, differences, arguments, disappointments & heartbreaks.Love is when seeing them vulnerable makes you strong enough to pick up both of you.Love is when you completely ,not only accept but adore a person the way they are.Love is when you can endure any amout of pain for their well-being and happiness.Love is when their presence electrifies you.Physical, emotional as well as mental intimacy are desired and are a NEED in true love.Love is when their mere existence magically strengthens us towards the harsh realities of life and makes this world seem a lovely place.If these are some of the strings which connect you with someone, then believe me ,you are in UNCONDITIONAL love with that person. Never ever let go of that person.(if the feelings are mutual) When you do things SELFLESSLY for someone only then there is LOVE otherwise it is just an illusuion. Yes, respecting and liking that person, caring for that person, wanting their happiness are all vitalities of love. But some signs like - Every romantic song adding colour to your life, your heart beating frantically in their proximity, heart craving for their attention, you being possessive about them, eyes yearning for a glance of them, your thoughts commencing and terminating with their thoughts.. Can’t be the basis of judging that whether you are in love or not. Such things do happen when one falls in love, considering what kind of person one is. But many a times these are just thoughts woven by our mind making one forget the difference between reality and imagination. Teenagers easily fall prey to it as they are yet to overcome the ‘Opposite sex attraction’ science and are still pretty immature to understand it. So if you have found your true love , then you are very fortunate , because it is indeed very rare. As everyone is not capable of embarking on the journey of LOVE and continuing it forever . All the best!!.. May your love keeps blooming and never perishes. Thanks for reading till the end :) Feel free to opine.

Sometimes it can be hard to distinguish between loving someone and being in love with someone. The problem lies within loving everything about someone and wanting to be with that person 24/7 while doing anything for them regardless of it being something you don’t want to do. To give you an example, there’s this girl that I can’t stop thinking about. I’ve known her for years and every time I think about her I imagine being with her and supporting her and sacrificing the world for her. I’ve tried to convince myself that: It wouldn’t work, we have different interestsShe’s kind of a lot younger than meShe mentioned something about her religion that might or might not have something to do with dating (want to respect her personal and religious journey)If I made any moves or were to be rejected, I’d have to see her again (because we both volunteer for a non profit)She’s in college and I wouldn’t want to influence her future career choicesThe world doesn’t need more babies (sounds really cynical but you’re actually saving the world from overpopulating)Some of the above shows my insecurities but it’s how I’ve tried to make myself not be in love with her. If none of this (convincing yourself you’re not in love with this person) works, and I know this can’t be healthy but it’s worth a shot, then you’re in love. In my experience, this is how I know I’m “in love” with someone…Why? Because I can’t stop thinking about her and wanting to be with her even though I’ve tried endlessly to persuade myself into believing that I’m not in love with her. But just because I’m in love with her doesn’t mean we would be perfectly fit for each other because I haven’t pursued her! I just know I’m in love with her. I haven’t tried to pursue her and she doesn’t know my intentions so it doesn’t help me to know if this is Love or not. Assumptions can get you into trouble because they solidify a concept in your mind. A concept of the type of relationship you think and then believe to have with that person. I don’t know your situation but you need to find out if he/she feels the same otherwise everything will always be platonic. And right now, I’ve convinced myself for other reasons that our relationship is platonic. BUT. If you want to avoid this “idea” of the relationship that you’ve formed in your head about that person being questionable, be straight up and ask. Bottom line: If you’re asking yourself “Am I in love?” Then you probably are. The quickest but hardest way to know the answer to the real question “Is this love?” is to actually pursue the person. Ask him/her on a date or do a few one on one hang outs to see how things go. It’s the only way. For more on the difference between being in love with someone and loving someone, visit my answer to a similar question: Zachary Young's answer to How do you know if your in love with someone or just love that person? Well…Godspeed my friend and don’t assume, just ask and pursue! That’ll answer your question real quick.

i have stpd, which is a personality disorder that makes it very difficult for me to have close relationships with anyone. so for me it was pretty easy to tell that i was going to fall for my boyfriend when i agreed to meet him in person. he only lived 40 minutes away, so it wasn’t too big of a deal. but i wanted to take things slow because i’m naturally opposed to the idea of trusting others and spending time with others. after about a month of being in the “we’re not dating but we have hour-long phone calls every other night, and send suggestive memes to one another hourly” stage, he brought up the idea of going on an actual date and i said yes. immediately. without thought. to put this action into perspective, i have acquaintances of close to a decade that i cancel on with the slightest hint of anxiety. we met at a coffee shop that is literally a block away from my house, and i walked there in the snow and nearly froze my nose off just to meet him. also because there was no way in hell i was getting in a car with a stranger, right? the coffee shop closed at 5pm, and after we discussed the many exciting things to do in my hometown on a sunday night (such as drive to Target and play Mario Kart in the gaming section, and then walk to the Dollar Tree and buy some candy or drinks, and then go to a park and sit inside his car and listen to music while staring at the snow) he smiled and said “let’s do it then!” this was the second action that made me realize i was in for it. i got into his car. the third? less than a week after our first date, we had our first kiss. and by first kiss, i mean we sat in his car at the park in the dead of winter and absolutely destroyed each other’s mouths until the early hours of the morning. we were like stupid, horny teenagers. (we were 18, so technically we were stupid, horny teenagers… but i like to think i’m mentally at least 30.) we rinsed and repeated this routine for about a month, until i was ready to let him into my home. as of right now, i’m not sure when it happened but i’m definitely in love with him. i could probably find a moment every day where i think, “i’m in love with that man.” i think it happens when you’re not waiting for it, sometimes when you don’t even want it. the universe is cruel that way. if you’re not sure if you love your partner the way you expect to, then maybe it’s not what you feel, but how you percieve it. maybe you don’t know how it really feels until it happens. maybe you’ve felt it before and didn’t know it. all i know is that i’m in love. i haven’t a clue how i know that. i’m sorry this isn’t of much help, but maybe it’ll ease your mind to know that the universe isn’t going to let you run yourself ragged trying to figure it out forever. when it is time, you’ll know. trust yourself and be open to your emotions.

Here are 7 symptoms to check if you’re in love : 7. Hormonal changes  It’s already known that a group of certain hormones is responsible for strong feelings. The release of these hormones makes people experience romantic feelings and passion that they can’t control very well. But men’s signs of falling in love are different from women’s. At first, their emotional and sexual preferences match: men become more romantic, tender, and attentive because of oxytocin, while women experience a burst of energy and a high sex drive because of testosterone. But unfortunately, when the level of hormones returns to its normal state, women feel a lack of attention and men miss the number of intimate moments. 6. Voice changes  The changes in our bodies don’t stop when the period of passionate love ends. For example, our voice still changes. According to one study, when a woman speaks to her beloved, her voice unconsciously gets softer and higher. On the other hand, other research revealed that women can manipulate their voice pitch making it lower with more vibrations to be more attractive. But the thing is, men unconsciously prefer women whose voice pitch is high and “womanly”. It’s all about our instincts: such a voice indicates that a woman is caring and reliable, and is ready for a long-term relationship. A lower voice attracts men only physically as it’s mostly about sexual interest. 5. Uncontrollable blushing  A guy or girl of your dreams comes into your life, smiles at you, and passes by. It may not seem like something special but your cheeks are already red and you can’t do anything about it. Modern psychologists found out that blushing is actually useful and can make you more likable. According to one theory, it’s a natural reaction to the fear of being “found out”. Psychologist Ray Crozier has interviewed many people about situations that cause them to turn red, and he found that it most typically involves the potential exposure of something private, not connected to embarrassing situations. The blushing may be a physiological reaction to the shock that your secret could become public. But how can this cause an attraction to another person? It’s easy: in such cases, your reddened face shows that you want to avoid excessive attention, giving the impression of a shy and less narcissistic person. And if we consider the fact that blushing is uncontrollable, we may say that it’s one of the most reliable features of honesty. 4. Men’s bones get stronger.  Here’s some good news for men! Studies at the University of California in Los Angeles show that married men and men in long-term relationships (especially those who are older than 25) have stronger and healthier bones. But here’s one important takeaway: a relationship or marriage is happier when a woman is caring and supportive. During this trial, it was found that if a woman wasn’t tender and loving, there was no high bone strength revealed. 3. Dilated pupils  Eyes play a really important role at the beginning of a relationship, and the eyes’ changes and movements are the most reliable signals when it comes to understanding our mood while spending time with our beloved. Scientists have already proven that pupil dilation depends not only on light but on our emotional state as well. That’s why loving people look into each others’ eyes: they’re unconsciously trying to see if this can be seen in the person they’re in love with. 2. A painful state  Confusion, nervousness, mood swings, loss of appetite, and fatigue are also on the list of symptoms that are caused by falling in love. Our bodies let us know that we’re plunging into really strong feelings. Cortisol, a stress hormone, can be one of the reasons for our suffering because when a person is falling in love, they experience lots of emotions and great stress. For example, blood vessels in our stomach constrict and we feel nausea. As a rule, all unpleasant symptoms go away when our relationship becomes more stable and there’s no more uncertainty. But sometimes these feelings can come back like during a wedding or if something goes wrong in a relationship. 1. Superpowers  You’ve probably heard about people doing impossible things in emergency situations: mothers have lifted cars with their own hands to free their child. The things is, love and fear literally give us superpowers. And it happens to more than just parents, it’s also present in people in love. This is due to the oxytocin that is released into our systems when we fall in love and it can actually increase our tolerance for physical pain. That’s why people experiencing this strong and beautiful feeling think that they’re able to do anything for their beloved. The last one kinda proves that true love does exist.

“Love is mystical,it gives you ability to heal,transform and strengthen your soul”. Biological basis of love: Day dreaming about the person, you feel his/ her presence. You get driven away by their thoughts. Their face brings a smile on your face. You feel that he/ she is exceptional and drowned in their thoughts. Mere sight of your love can give an impulse to your brain that begins releasing dopamine and serotonin, which not only increases your focus on person but also gives you immense pleasure. Almost a drug like effect! These chemicals regulate sleep, hunger, emotional behavior, activity, now we know why even a mild rift in love can lead to anorexia and insomnia. Infact, heart racing, sweating, mood swings become more common when we are in love and these chemical begin regulating our bodies and mind.  However, apart from biological aspects that affect the mechanism and dynamics of body. Behavioral changes also become more evident- We make attempts for the special one, to make them feel special.We become open to any amendments that may be asked for.We change we change for better (no noticing of other men or women), we begin accepting their past, the differences we have. forgiving and forgetting their mistakesWe spent too much time in grooming and dressing up. More focused on how we look and how we present ourselves before the loved one.Behavior modification is something we all do especially when the relationship is green and at an early stage.we tend to become cautious about words we choose in our conversations,and for their feelings as well.We begin planning for future, marriage vacations and begin seeing life years from now.You prioritize your special someone, everything else takes a back seat. You miss your workout because she is on call with you, Your plan with your friends are swapped because she/ he is on Skype with you.You care and you are concerned for their well being, you are worried when calls are not answered or a message is not seen for a long time, his/ her no see leaves you bewildered and annoyed too.Thus, when in love, a cumulative effect of everything turns you into something you never thought you would be. Sometimes it's worth if you can govern your feelings. otherwise it brings contrition if you loose the reins you have hard time curbing your emotions.

There are many kinds of love. You can't rely on a single way to know whether you are in love or have been struggling in love. However, when you meet the special person in your heart, if you pay attention to the feeling and performance in your heart at that time, you should know whether you really fall in love. If you want to know how to do it, please follow the method below. What would be your future without your partner If you really love him (her), you can't imagine what kind of future you will have without him (her). Whether you want to move to a new city, have children, stay abroad for a year, or realize any dream in the future, you should think that your dear one will always be with you. If you can't predict and imagine life without your partner, it seems that you may really love your partner.  Can you spend hours without your lover in your mind If you have a healthy relationship, you will allocate your time to other things instead of imagining what he or she is doing at the moment every five seconds. But if you don't have any information about him or her in your mind for a whole week or a month, you probably like him very much, but you haven't reached the stage of love. Here are some other signs that mean you fall in love with him. When you are reading or watching a movie without him, you will wonder what he thinks of the work. When you try on new clothes yourself, you will consider whether he will like your dress. You text him, call him, if it's just to say hello to him or listen to his voice, then you may really fall in love.  Do you respect each other's opinions or opinions If you love him, you will attach great importance to the other person's point of view and care about his or her ideas, whether in your next career choice or in the political situation of your country. But if you don't fall in love with him, you won't care about the other person's emotional input and his attitude towards everything. Here are the signs that you love him. When you're making big decisions, you can take your partner's point of view into account. If you are in trouble in society, you attach great importance to his opinions on your next plan. If you care what he thinks about news, politics, art, or something else that's important to you, you may fall in love with him. Does your partner want you to improve yourself Even if you are satisfied with your partner, you should not just be satisfied with your current situation. Although it is very important to coexist peacefully with your partner and establish a happy love relationship, being with him should help you to elevate your life to another level and make you the best of yourself forever. If by the side of your lover, you are trying to correct your shortcomings and constantly improve your personality, you may really be in love.  Are you willing to help your partner Love is made up of giving and receiving. If you really love each other, your pay and return should be equal. You'd love to surprise each other with coffee or desserts from her favorite bakery, and you don't think it's a waste of your precious time. Whether it's teaching your partner to make the perfect hamburger or complex math problems, you'll be happy.

I remember, about 10 years ago was when we first talked to each other. We were about 5 or 6. He once bullied me about my weight (what a peice of shit! He was just as chubby as me as a kid!) and we, at some point, became worst enemies in preschool. Until one day, we had some conversation that didn't include us fighting, I didn't remember what he said, but I do remember the promise we made. “Promise we're not going to bully each other anymore? We're now best friends!” “Promise!” That was how I had my enemy turn to my friend, then maybe considered him my childhood crush. After 10 years, we we're still good friends. Of course at some point we had separate groups of friends and we weren't together everyday for 10 years straight. I had a crushes on other boys and he had crushes on other girls. That wasn't until 7th grade, we became as close as before, and I remember telling him he was my first crush. Little did I know what I felt as a little kid will come back. It's been 3 years, and that hasn't changed. I still feel butterflies around him. He knows I like him, I told him 2 years ago. Telling him didn't change anything or make anything awkward, which I'm glad for. I enjoy his company. He didn't directly tell me he doesn't like me back, but I'm pretty sure that's the case. Now, how do I know I'm in love? Well, after hours of thinking, I thought although I like him, I felt alright even if he didn't like me back. All I wanted for him is to be happy and be made happy by someone, even if that someone wasn't me. I felt satisfied from the thought that he's laughing and smiling and feeling great. What I've learned through all those years is that real love makes you selfless, not selfish. Love doesn't make you think only of your happiness, but also the happiness of the one who you hold dear. <3

Some weird symptoms you may experience when you fall in love: 1. When you fall in love, your cheeks blush, your heart beats faster, your palms are sweaty and your head starts spinning. All thanks to a rush of hormones that flood your brain and body when you fall in love. There’s nothing you can do about this. After all, love is blind, doesn’t know whether to disturb mind or heart.  2. You wake up and go to sleep thinking of someone other than yourself. The truth is this phenomenon is usually subconscious and automatic, almost like your mind is programmed to do so. Though, it is nice to think of someone beside you. 3. You smile when you’re alone. We all noticed this. You could quite often smile when he or she texts you, when you hear a song, see his/her picture on Facebook or when you just think of that person. So, little things like these will make you smile quite often than usual because you are just so ecstatically in love. 4. You do embarrassing things. Love will make you do embarrassing things because when you’re falling in love with someone. You will do almost anything to make him/her happy, no matter what other people may think. 5. You do things outside of your comfort zone. Just to make him/her happy, you are ready to do anything even if it is not your cup of team. For example: a boy ready to go for shopping and carry shopping bags, though he don’t like. Similarly, a girl could sit and watch “Sports” Channel just because her love like watching it. Sometimes doing these things can open your mind to new activities you might enjoy. Especially when you are doing them with the one you love. In short, sub-conscious feeling of love makes us crazy, but it also makes us happy. Love is exciting, addicting, confusing and weird. Though, we all want to love and get loved.  Hope this helps. Thank you!

I say “bahhh” to everything else that was written in reply. Being in love with someone should be looked at in an entirely different light. True Love has nothing to do with any of that. Your ACTIONS dictate whether you are- or aren’t. Specifically, your actions toward that other person will tell you everything you need to know. Look in your heart, you know what I say to be true. When your actions are in line with your feelings, then, only then, can you say you are really truly in love with someone. Love for someone else, being in love with that person, requires a firm hand (not abusive by any means), a tender heart, and… ACTIONS. It also requires that you truly love yourself, first. Honestly, from what you wrote, it doesn’t sound like that is the case. You might love her (sounds more like “new relationship” love to me), but to be truly in love with her, start acting like it. If your heart or mind wanders, it wasn’t real. The other person doesn’t consume you, like you have described in your various musings about her; that is all more insecurity in yourself than anything else, it seems. When you strive to be the best you can possibly be in every aspect of your life, no roadblocks, no fear, and you want to do that so she has everything she could ever want— not just things, but the physical and emotional trust that comes with knowing that you will never harm her in any way- then you’ll be in love. You must give everything. It’s risky business, love. But the payoff is a life well led.

What a hot item, yaar. Chotu, one of my friends said while pointing his finger towards a passing by girl. Don’t do that. I warned him. Just chill, man. This is not the first time, I am doing this. He said. That’s why I am telling you not to do it. I don’t like it. I replied. Boys are used to do these things. Even girls like us this way. He said and laughed. You are out of your mind. So, better behave. I yelled at him. By the way, I don’t know any girl who likes teasing. So, whenever you guys are with me, better not to do this. Oh, common man, you are living in old era. this is young generation, we should do more fun. Another friend said. You all are rascals. I scolded them. I don’t like these things. It’s okay. Just look at this one. Chotu argued. I gave him a rude look and slowly turned back. This is the story when I was in the first year of my college. As I belong to a small town, there, friend means boy is friend with boy and girl is friend with girl. You can’t have the luxury of bigger cities, where, a boy can be friend with a girl or vice-versa. So, when you can’t have a company of girls, some idiotic people do these kind of things. Especially college going boys do these kinds of things to look cool like bunking classes, teasing girls, fighting over nothing, etc. Like all boys, I also used to do many of those things except teasing girls. Anyways, lets continue the story. I couldn’t see her face as she was walking away from us and her back was towards me. She wore a red and yellow mixed coloured suit. As I couldn’t see her face, my eyes followed the part of her body which was uncovered. That’s her feet! First time in my life, I realized that someone can have such beautiful feet. It was very fair with mixed red and pink color. That thought immediately followed by another thought. If she has such beautiful feet, how beautiful she might look like. That thought ignited my desire to see her face and I became restless to see her. I was desperately hoping her to look back. Perhaps, Chotu realized that and he shouted, turn back. I immediately covered his mouth in ordered to keep his voice down but till then she heard his voice. She stopped for a while and turned back as fast as she could. Then, first time I saw her face. I hadn’t seen her before in the town. She was very beautiful, big black eyes, fair cheeks, naturally red lips. My heart started pumping fast. I never felt like that before, I got totally lost in her beauty. She stood in her place for some time. Then she proceeded towards me. There was too much anger in her eyes because she must had thought that I called her like that. For a second, I thought she was going to slap me. But she came near me, looked into my eyes for few second and warned me by pointing her finger on my chest. Then she turned back and went away in anger. I remained still at my place. What happened bro, did you like her? Chotu asked. What. Shut up, you speak anything. I came to my senses and replied hurriedly. Something must has happened. He again said cunningly. No, not at all. Let’s eat samosa. I said to divert the matter. After that, I came home. I tried to read but couldn’t. I tried to sleep but couldn’t. Every time, I tried to do anything, her face used to come before me. The way she turned, her beauty, her anger, her courage when she was warning me, the whole scene, started repeating over and over in my mind like filmstrips. The whole night I was awake, and I don’t know why I was smiling while remembering every scene that happened. Something totally new was happening with me but I was not able to understand what it was. Next morning, I dig some information about her name, home, school, etc from my sources and then I started chasing her without her knowledge. I started roaming around her house, school and other places just to have a look of her. For many days, neither I tried to speak to her nor I tried to come into her attention. Although many a times we crossed paths, but I used to cover myself by showing that it happened accidentally. I was not able to understand, when I had nothing to do with her then why the hell, I was following her. It started happening every day & became my daily routine and it started hampering my other routines. One day Chotu came to my home. “Where have you been man?” He asked. I just looked at him, smiled but didn’t answer. “What is the meaning of this smile?” He asked again. “Nothing.” I said, and started playing with a ball. “What nothing? Neither you come to college nor you attend cricket practice. You didn’t even meet us. What happened to you brother?” He asked worriedly. “You will not understand.” I replied with a smile and kept doing what I was doing. “Try me!” He caught the ball and said. “Do you remember that girl, whom you were teasing that day?” I asked. “Oh, that item!” “Never talk like that about her, ever.” I grabbed his collar and warned him. “Okay, chill pill. I am sorry man, what about that girl?” I slowly released his collar and told him about my feelings about her. “Are you in love with her?” He asked out of curiosity. I looked at him for a second then deeply exhaled and told him. “I don’t know but whenever she comes before me, I forget everything. Whenever I see her, my heart starts beating very fast. I feel like, I can do anything for her. I don’t remember anything except her. I am not even liking my favorite things. If this is love, then yes, I am in love with her.” “You are a gone case man.” He said and we both laughed. Love at first sight.

Being “taken” ie taken for granted for last 20 years or so, I will try to give my “best shot” based upon my trivial experiences. Well…. I will be answering from my male point of view ie How do you know that you love a girl? So you know you are in “deep love” with a girl when:- You attend the super sleepy & boring morning lectures in college just to catch a glimpse of “her” or you prepare a topic beforehand that's to be taught in class next day, in order to impress “her”You do not stare at her “curves” and her “assets” rather you lose yourself by looking at her beautiful face and get drowned in the ocean of her sparking eyes.Your eyes automatically rests on the curls on her hair or the mole on her face but immediately move off your eyes once you see her looking at you.You crazily think of talking with her, but once the situation comes, out of extreme nervousness you start stammering and finally end up falling short of topics of discussion.Her WhatsApp or Facebook dps are saved in your phone's gallery and you later stare at those photos with blank eyes in the moments of solitude, realizing the epitome of beauty she is. But out of shyness, you refrain from commenting on her photos.She's your last thought when you go to sleep and your first thought when you wake up from sleep.You feel sad because she doesn't reply to your messages even though they are “seen” by her or when she takes too long to reply to a “hi”, it makes you feel so unwanted.You feel jealous of the guys with whom she hangs out and you feel like hitting the guy who tried to hit on her.Although you “smile” when she calls you as her “best friend” while she likes the guy called “X”, but your heart gets broken into thousands of pieces.You feel dejected on realizing that you are not more than a “friend with Benefits” for her, whom she merely used at her hours of requirement. You being severely wounded by “Cupid's arrow” decide to give importance to the other priorities of your lifeBut the wounds caused by Love doesn't get cured so easily. Only Love can heal the wounds caused by Love and this form of love is what we call the “Motherly Love” the purest form of love that ever existed in our Nature. Thank you for reading.

How do you know if you're in love? People who are in love generally feel a powerful sense of empathy toward their beloved, feeling the other person's pain as their own and being willing to sacrifice anything for the other person.Can't get that girl or guy out of your head? Daydreaming about the person when you should be working? Imagining your futures together? These dizzying thoughts may be signs of love. In fact, scientists have pinned down exactly what it means to "fall in love." Researchers have found that an in-love brain looks very different from one experiencing mere lust, and it's also unlike a brain of someone in a long-term, committed relationship. Studies led by Helen Fisher, an anthropologist at Rutgers University and one of the leading experts on the biological basis of love, have revealed that the brain's "in love" phase is a unique and well-defined period of time, When you're in love, you begin to think your beloved is unique. The belief is coupled with an inability to feel romantic passion for anyone else. Fisher and her colleagues believe this single-mindedness results from elevated levels of central dopamine — a chemical involved in attention and focus — in your brain

This question reminds me of a story I read sometime back about a man and a woman meeting in an art gallery and discussing their views on love. Neither of them had fallen in love before and they both seemed to be under the impression that love is not necessary in order for a man and woman to live together as a couple. It's always possible to live together and just be friends. To convince themselves of this hypothesis, they decided to give living together with each other a try since they felt they could be good friends and had common views on matters of love. However, just to be sure, they pondered over the question of 'In case love did happen, how would one be able to tell?' After giving it some thought, the man said, 'Maybe if I ever happen to use my money for buying cigarette on something else instead...something for you, that is, I would say that's love.' The woman, listening to this, replied, ' Well, if I ever happen to worry about you being late for dinner, I'd know it's love'. Thus they defined 'love' in their own ways, accepted each other's definitions and went ahead with living together as a couple. A few months later, the man came back home late one night and found the woman sitting on a chair waiting for him. Seeing she hadn't touched her dinner yet, he asked, ' Everything all right? Why haven't you eaten yet?' The woman looked at her, held her gaze for a few seconds and then gave a faint smile before saying,' I think it's happened for me, you know! I was worried about you getting so late and so couldn't eat'. Now the man seemed troubled and he stood still for a while saying nothing. Then he came towards her, went round the chair and placing his hand on the chair's back sighed, ' I wanted to buy you a book and spent my money on it instead of buying cigarettes. I wanted to find the right kind of book and that took me a while...' Define 'love' your own way and you'll be always be able to tell.

He loves me ... he does not love me ... if only finding the answer to this question was as simple as stripping a flower. So, what makes it possible to determine if a man really likes you? Love can be very delicate. And when you add to that all the social obstacles to overcome, you can quickly find yourself overwhelmed by confusion. For centuries, people have struggled to solve the very complex mystery of love. Think of all the poems, stories, paintings and statues that have been inspired by love and the quest for it. The reality is that every human being has a different love story, and since we are all unique, our stories are different from each other. Here are some signs that love could be on your doorstep. Share this list and do not forget to leave a comment! 1. He is curious ... ... smaller things that do not really matter. He took note of how you drink your tea, not just in case it should make you one, but because it also reflects one aspect of your personality. Actually, it's a small detail that does not say much about you, but it's related to you. Think about your favorite singer when you were ten: did not you want to know his birthday and his favorite food? But why? No, of course, that does not make you a stalker, you just wanted to get a little closer to something you liked, and it could be similar to what your man is doing with you. 2. It does not just give you attention ... ... It's just that he can literally stop himself from doing it. He's not just looking at you, he's obviously struggling to look away. It is not a question here of "examining you", although he did it at first. It looks at you even when you have a messy bun or sweat, or even while you are jogging. 3. He encourages you Whether you give a public address or participate in a ping pong game, he is your biggest fan. He likes to see you win. He cares about your happiness and fun activities that bring you happiness. Learn more about love from this article.

Whenever the person is around things seem beautiful and pieces start falling into place in your heart. It is a feeling which if you can explain then it ain’t love, if you can’t then you’re already in love. We were dating for a while at the time this incident happened. One day I was trying to make a hole on a bag's trap, and I accidentally let the knife cut me. It was so painful and I bleed a lot. Yet I was calm and neutral, asking my boyfriend for helping me. He freaked out, and I was laughing at him saying, "Look at you, freaking out at this thing! I'm good, no worry!" Then few days later, one evening my boyfriend was washing some plates, and somehow he managed(!) to break one bowl which later cut himself quite badly. His left hand was covered in blood. I was standing by the window when I turned back to look at him and realized what went wrong. Now you should know that I didn't cry when I cut myself. But when I saw him with his cut, I bursted out crying. My tears kept falling I could not even explain why. I rushed into my room, my brain repeated desperately “Find something like a bandage or plaster", and I fully acknowledged that I need anything to stop the bleeding, but I just couldn't. My hands were almost shaking and my muscles seemed to stop working. There was an intense, burning pain in my chest that I've never felt before, I felt like there were thousands of knives stabbing in my heart, my lungs, my chest. My body temperature went up as I struggled to figure out what to bring him. When I managed to bring (instead of only what was necessary) the whole medicine and plaster box, his bleeding finally stop. He was looking at me like he want to both laugh at me and hug me at the same time, while still I felt the pain and I was sobbing for a long moment after that before I could completely calm down. That was when I knew I were in love. It felt like his bleeding fingers have some sort of connectivity with my physical status. It reminded me of a scene in one movie from the Twilight series (I know you might say this is lame but haha) when Bella sacrificed herself for Edward when he was tortured, since she didn't want him to suffer. "Kill me, kill me. Not him". People with extreme sensitivity might have these feelings easily from probably ordinary things, but for most of us, I suppose it is love. It is love that we feel happy when your partner is jubilant and hurtful when he/ she is sad/ in pain. We become emotionally vulnerable when we are in love, and there is a strong connection between the other person's situation and your own. Often our emotions are unpleasant when our partner is unhappy, depressed, anxious etc., and the pain is extreme when they suffer severe health issues, or when they pass away, for instance. As with most things in life, romantic relationships are, for many of us, a double-edged sword: while most find it wonderful to love and be loved, developing intimate emotional ties to someone makes us emotionally vulnerable—vulnerable not only to being hurt by our partner's opinions of and feelings toward us, but also vulnerable to being affected by our partner's bad moods. - There is a thing called broken heart syndrome, believed to occur when someone loses a close partner or spouse. Death of a spouse is recognised as one of the most stressful things that can happen to a person. But as well as the mental anguish and grief (which are themselves very debilitating and not to be dismissed), many forget that stress also has a physical component. Stress can cause numerous physical ailments, and if the stress is sudden and serious enough, such as if a spouse dies, then these ailments can be very serious, affecting the heart. It's risky to be in love. But worth it. How To Manage Your Partner's Bad Moods Why elderly couples often die together: the science of broken hearts

You know you’re in love when she’s all you think of. You know you’re in love when she’s all you dream of. Back in college, I used to have a crush on this girl. Boy, I used to be crazy about her. So crazy, that at one point I was convinced that I had fallen for her. Absolutely hated the feeling. It’s a beautiful feeling though. There’s nothing like it. Nothing better than it, yet nothing worse off. You find poetry in her movements. You find certainty in her actions. You find beauty in pain, pain that is self-inflicted, and not on others. Your threshold to nuisance is set to infinity. You’ve never been calmer, but your insides have never screamed louder. You’ve never lived like this before, and you’ve never felt more alive. And oh, the butterflies. Thousands of them that you feel in your abdomen. The feeling is infectious. It spreads like cancer. But a one that could cure you of any illness. It glides like a butterfly, stings like a bee. It kills you from the inside, yet your life has never been more “livable”. You feel weak at the knees, but the rest of your body has never been more strong. You could have done a thousand crunches, a million planks, but your abdomen would have never felt a beating like this before, beatings from the thousands of butterflies that circulate in your stomach. You’re no longer the most important person in the world. Your brain turns its back on you. It switches side when you need it the most. But your heart has got your back. It is true what they say about love, after all. Love is what happens when an unstoppable force meets an immovable object. What struck me was definitely “unstoppable”. And she? Most definitely “immovable”. There was a point in time when she was all I used to think of, from the second I wake up. She was all I used to think of all-through the day until the second I sleep. Heck! She used to conquer most of my dreams. When love hits you, you change as a person. You become soft. Suddenly you’re the most empathetic person in the world. The world starts making more sense. You finally understand what all these poets have been writing in their poems. You realize that it is a beautiful world after all. The flowers, the plants, the grass, the birds, the sky, the clouds, the rain, oh dear the rain are things you newly develop an affinity towards. You’ve never felt more helpful before. You’ve never felt more helpless before. Do you ever realise that when you view a bird, a majestic one, you forget the sky behind? Similarly, when you see her - the world behind her fades, freezes, and ceases to exist. “You know you’re in love when you can’t fall asleep because the reality is finally better than your dreams” - Dr.Seuss  To end things, it feels like you’re flying. You’d know you’d break when you fall, shatter when you fail. Everyone around you is going to tell you the same. But when you meet someone worth it, who are we to say? You’d choose to fly anyway. *Image courtesy: WikiHow

This one by Bob Marley defines love the best, I believe... "Only once in your... life, I truly believe, you find someone who can completely turn your world around. You tell them things that you’ve never shared with another soul and they absorb everything you say and actually want to hear more. You share hopes for the future, dreams that will never come true, goals that were never achieved and the many disappointments life has thrown at you. When something wonderful happens, you can’t wait to tell them about it, knowing they will share in your excitement. They are not embarrassed to cry with you when you are hurting or laugh with you when you make a fool of yourself. Never do they hurt your feelings or make you feel like you are not good enough, but rather they build you up and show you the things about yourself that make you special and even beautiful. There is never any pressure, jealousy or competition but only a quiet calmness when they are around. You can be yourself and not worry about what they will think of you because they love you for who you are. The things that seem insignificant to most people such as a note, song or walk become invaluable treasures kept safe in your heart to cherish forever. Memories of your childhood come back and are so clear and vivid it’s like being young again. Colours seem brighter and more brilliant. Laughter seems part of daily life where before it was infrequent or didn’t exist at all. A phone call or two during the day helps to get you through a long day’s work and always brings a smile to your face. In their presence, there’s no need for continuous conversation, but you find you’re quite content in just having them nearby. Things that never interested you before become fascinating because you know they are important to this person who is so special to you. You think of this person on every occasion and in everything you do. Simple things bring them to mind like a pale blue sky, gentle wind or even a storm cloud on the horizon. You open your heart knowing that there’s a chance it may be broken one day and in opening your heart, you experience a love and joy that you never dreamed possible. You find that being vulnerable is the only way to allow your heart to feel true pleasure that’s so real it scares you. You find strength in knowing you have a true friend and possibly a soul mate who will remain loyal to the end. Life seems completely different, exciting and worthwhile. Your only hope and security is in knowing that they are a part of your life.” -Bob Marley

Well, how do you know when…you are lost? Or when your car needs oil? Or when it’s your birthday? There are some clues, right? And some clues are obvious, and some are not? It’s kind of like that. Love means wanting to see the other person again, and soon. Love is about wanting to get close to that other person. Love tends to be a bit confusing. And for lots of people, feeling love for someone is a bit disturbing. It may be disturbing, when one is otherwise comfortable, to have these “love” feelings intrude. And love is a bit idealistic, too. Like the other person is just the best ever. Kind of ridiculous, when you think about it. But then, how nice is it if someone loves you, and thinks you are just the best ever? And the other part of the issue is that you may be wrong. Or, about as bad, that you are in love, and the other person…is not. Not even close. That is very disturbing. So there is some risk involved. This can be very upsetting to some people. As a result, most people are kind of cautious about saying they love someone.

A record number of women said they had fallen in love with The Bachelor’s Ben Higgins this season. Maybe these women were caught up in the allure of exotic dates and romantic gestures or maybe some of them were really falling in love with Bachelor Ben. Love is both exciting and confusing. So how can we tell when we have really fallen in love? A lot happens in our mind and body when we’ve fallen in love. We get feelings of euphoria, passion, and happiness. There are clues Bachelor Ben should notice that can help point him to the right woman. Here’s how to know what true love looks like: 1. Thinking About Them Constantly When you’re in love with someone, they’re your first thought in the morning and your last thought at night. Your mind frequently thinks of them and the time you spent together. When you have good news you want to share it with them first. When you’re stressed out or had a bad day, you want their support before anyone else’s.  2. Time Together is Meaningful A big difference between love and lust is how you spend your time together. If you’re spending time together laughing, talking about things that are important to you both, and being yourselves around one another — you could be falling in love. If the majority of your time together is spent hooking up and being physical, then it’s probably lust.  3. Miss Them When Apart When someone becomes a huge part of our lives, time away from them is difficult. If you find yourself missing someone immensely when you’re apart, and then you are over-the-moon excited about seeing them again, it’s a good sign love is in the air.  4. Want to Talk About Them You can’t help but talk about your new beau to family and friends. You find small ways to bring them up in conversations. Every chance you get you name drop them. You speak praisingly about them. 5. Accepting of Their Imperfections No one’s perfect. But when you’re in love with someone, you don’t find their imperfections and quirks annoying. You actually like her loud, cackling laugh or the way he is so meticulous with everything in his garage.  6. Rather Do Nothing With Them Than Anything Else You’d rather spend time with your loved one, doing nothing, than going to the most exciting event with someone else. You simply want to be with them. Being in their company trumps doing anything else. 7. Thinking About the Future You start to picture a life together. You can’t imagine your life without them and you start thinking long term. You want to spend time with their family and friends to get to know them even better. As opposed to liking or being infatuated with someone which is so much more focused only on the here and now.

IMO, falling is the key word here. Love is actually a sacrificial “extreme empathy” in wanting the betterment for another (or others) and has zero return expectations This is why “loving” and not wanting to be discovered by the recipient, is the highest form of a sacrificial “true love”. That means that if you want something (like “to be noticed”) then that love is already tainted. But of course we mix the mate selecting and mating rituals with this “true love” and that can easily mess up the “true love” part of the equation (because we are genetically drawn to mate). With all that said, “falling in love” is actually an infatuation and most commonly, it is a result of the mating ritual of “I would like to mate and procreate” with that person. Yes, we use very romantic words and images for this process (and that is as it should be given the importance of this process). So it is the ”being tipped over” sense of falling (losing your balance) that is the essence of falling in love. We have an image in our mind (a mix of past experiences and innate beauty traits, including language and body language) hinting at “approachability” or even the opposite: impervious (confident and disciplined). It is said that Cleopatra was not as physically beautiful (in our current definition of that) but knew language and body language that was irresistible to most men (if/when she chose to display it). We also know that Marilyn Monroe learned and used coy and available physical and language displays as lures for men and many men were lured (JFK, for one).   Those are more obvious examples of what some men find attractive. Women generally have a different criteria and seek a confident and capable male so they can be on the look out for displays that align with that. Below are some well known exaggerated metaphors for this more traditional match. That traditional match is deeply programmed in our genes and of course, is tempered by our individual experiences since birth. A hint of this remains in us (IMO) and is certainly part of the “maybe I found the right one” in our unconsciousness (if not consciousness). I believe this is the root cause of the “falling” sensation of romance in the pre-mating ritual. It can be a beautiful process but, due to it’s fundamental power in/over us) is highly prone to manipulation as well :) Lastly, remember, if you have very little experience with men or women “displaying” their availability you may be “bowled over” the first time you see someone making those displays. So proceed with caution: It might be your inexperience (inability to remain balanced) that is causing you to fall, not the other person’s “rightness for you”. That can be like a naive person seeing their first impressive colorful product advertisement so they impulsively run out and buy the product (and regret it later seeing that it was only an advertisement). :) Good luck!

How can you not know this? Me: Dude, chill and don't be desperate. You don't even know her properly. Love does not happen this way. He: Yes, yes, I know. Don't tell me.  I know a good friend of mine, she's in relationship with this guy for almost four years now. They both were batchmates for two years but didn't talk much. Both were the toppers of their respective sections. On the day of farewell party, they had their first pic together and talked a little bit. After final exams, they came into touch and started talking. Soon, they became friends. They shared their goals and targets.They talked about their family, life, people, world, cosmos and what not. They became best-friends. Fast forward to three-four years, they are a happy couple. Their thoughts and intellect level match. They both are complementary to each other. When my friend was in severe depression, he was there to make sure she'd taken her meals properly. He was there to tell her that everything will be fine. He was there to make her feel special at her worst. He was there to love her even when she wasn't having enough love for herself. And when he needed her, she made sure that she was his strength and not his weakness. She was there with him all throughout like his armour. They both love each other selflessly without expecting anything in return. So, whosoever you think you’re in love with, Can you love him/her selflessly? Can you be there with them in their worst? Can you sacrifice your happiness for them even without letting them know that? Can you? Love doesn't have to be intentional (as in the first case). And if it's intentional, it's not love. You don't plan to be in love. It just happens. From being acquaintances, to friends, to best-friends and then girlfriend/boyfriend. It's a long journey. You're in love when you think about them before thinking of yourself. You're in love if you fall for their heart and not face. You're in love when you find perfection in their flaws. You're in love when he/she is in your heart and not on your mind.

Love is hands the down the best feeling to experience in life. There is a certain time in the relationship when you begin to have feelings and emotions that you have not experienced before. I knew I fell in love with my partner when the thought of her would never leave my head. Being in love was not something I have ever experienced prior to meeting my fiancé. When I’m with her all I want to do is give her the world because of how great of a person she is. Love is something that is developed over time with patience and the intent to grow. How do know if you’re truly in love? Time vanishes. When you’re with your partner it just seems like time disappears. This happens because you are so in the moment with that person time seems to go away. Love makes time feel unreal and you get to experience being in the moment. Being fully focused because that person captures your time. You don’t mind spending time with this person and they’re captivating.You Forgive each other. Forgiveness is the key to growing your love for each other. When two people are in love it’s easier to forgive because you take the entire relationship into consideration. It’s important to build the habit of forgiving each other for getting upset or forgetting to do something. Make an agreement with each other that when you upset with one another that it’s not the intent.You communicate. Communication is the most important component to a strong relationship. When you can communicate with each other and be honest that’s love. It’s when we are able to tell the other person what is bothering us and not expecting them to know what the problem is. When you love someone communicating with them will not feel like it’s a challenge and it’ll come with ease. Make the agreement to be honest with each other and to talk when you feel hurt or something is bothering you.You’re committed to growing. When you are in a relationship begin to take the right steps to grow and strengthen it. This means that the two of you are willing to make agreements on certain disagreements. Make the commitment to hold each other accountable for accomplishing your goals and dreams. When you help each other grow in life it will make the relationship stronger and love more certain.These are some of the key factors that have helped me determine what “love” may be. There’s 7 billions people on this planet and we all experience emotions differently. I do assure you that if you apply these principles to your life they can help strengthen your relationship and connection. Love is beautiful. Thank you so much for reading! Please reach out to me if you have any questions!

True love takes work. No love will last forever (without effort), as people change over time and memories fade. The short of it — you know you’re truly in love if the other person is worth fighting for, despite every hardship, every argument, every unintended (and sometimes intended) insult; whether they’re sick or healthy, poor or rich, hurting, depressed or happy, and all sorts of places in between (provided they’re not abusive). And also, if they think of you that way. Now, I’m only 31, so I don’t have the most life experience to share this from, but I have been with the same woman for the last 10 years now — not because there are “magical” sparkles that flutter about us whenever we’re near each other. Not at all. We’ve committed to work through all our pain, hardships, trials, issues, etc. And that has been worth it. Knowing that she has my back, even when I have a bad day and accidentally snap at her (or our kids). Knowing that even when she does the same, I can trust that she will be willing to work through it. When we were financially tight, we were stressed, but we trusted each other, and worked together. What I do know, is that my parents are still together, since 1980, and my grandparents were able to celebrate their 70th wedding anniversary together, before my grandpa died. They’ve definitely worked for it. My dad tells me many times that his parents would fight, have issues, terrible moments, but they worked through it and remained married and in love in such a way that even I, as a child, was able to see it, and to the day my grandpa died, last year, despite my grandpa developing Alzheimer’s and nearly forgetting my grandma. My parents, likewise, had their share of issues — financial, work hours, etc. But they worked through it, and are still, to this day, incredibly affectionate with each other (my dad still grabs her butt… yeah). My wife and I also know that her parents (if you’d call them that) didn’t work at it, and were divorced under 5 years. Her mom married 3 times, but never attempted to make it work — it was always the guy’s fault, somehow, some way (even though she’s borderline narc). So, once again, you know that you’re truly in love when you know that other person is worth fighting for, and they believe the same of you.

Just because you two understand each other now and you call this love, you might be wrong coz even two hungry beggars understand each other’s hunger but they can’t fix it.If your girl grabs your hand when a beautiful girl passes by you or if you grab your girl’s hand when a handsome guy passes by her and you call this cute jealousy as love, then you might be wrong coz even birds are grabbed inside a cage to be captured and not to let them free.You fell in “love at first sight” and you call it love, then you might be wrong coz we even fall for antique items when we see them first but we keep them in our home for show off only.Just because you talk for late nights and you call this love, then you might be wrong coz even two strangers talk with each other to remove their loneliness.If you celebrate each of your monthly anniversary and you call this love, you might be wrong coz love doesn’t depend on number of days, months or years.Just because you both have become a part of each other’s Instagram stories and both of you comment on every pic of each other and you call this love, you might be wrong coz love isn’t saved among the filters of photos/comments, it’s just lived in that very moment.BUT BUT BUT, If you prefer to tangle among her messy hair first rather than tangling on her naked body, then it’s surely love.If she fearlessly expresses her childishness in front of you, then it’s surely love.If you open up all your secrets to her before she undresses her clothes, then it’s surely love.If she discloses all her fears before you without the fear of being judged and you also listen to it patiently as if listening to your favorite song, then it’s surely love.If every tear of hers falls only on your shirt and on no one else’s, then it’s surely love.If the reason for your smile is her immature and childish acts, then it’s surely love.So what are you waiting for? If you have truly found your love then go, hold, grab and hug her and whenever you get time, just say and express to her how much you love her coz it takes a very long period of your lifetime to find such a kind of love. Source:- Yahya Bootwala Poem - Adarsh Gupta  A sincere review from you all would encourage me to write even more. Te Amo ♥

The first thing you want when you wake up is the Good Morning message from them.When they look cute even when they send you pics just after waking up or while brushing their teeth.It’s when you feel the adrenaline rush in your body the moment you listen to their voice.When you are nervous every time you meet them.When you are super conscious if he/she is around.When a video call with them makes you blush the entire duration of call.When you visit a place and start thinking “I wish he/she was here”.When you want them to notice you and your presence.When your phone has less pictures of you and more of them.When you set a different ringtone/notification sound for their contact/Whatsapp because you don’t want to miss a minute by replying late.When you start listening to songs which they like.When their cologne becomes your favorite aroma.When you start talking to yourself thinking about them.It’s when you take a pillow and squeeze it in your arms because you are thinking of cuddling with them.When you keep your phone charged and keep checking it even if it’s lying next to you, just to see a notification by their name.When you don’t miss a single chance to have a conversation with them.It's when you never want to give up. on them.When you know you can fight with the whole world for them just to be together forever.When you know it might end any moment from their side but you still never lose hope.If you are thinking about that person while reading this.If you experience these situations everyday then you are surely in LOVE.

Well, falling in love can be a glorious feeling, as long as the other person feels the same about you. When you start falling in love, your life is all about that person. They are constantly on your mind. They are your obsession. Your first thought when you wake up in the morning is about them, and so is the last thought before going to sleep at night. You get absent-minded, clumsy, and look lost in a daze. You smile at them, you wanna be around them, you wanna talk to them all the time, you want them in your world, and them only! You are just head over heels in love with everything they say and do. You get their phone number and talk on the phone (Assuming they like you enough to do give those digits to you!) You can also connect to them on a social media platform. The only thing left to do is ask them out, where you continue the closeness, where one day, they feel these things for you. It is really mindblowing! Let me be clear. Falling in love can be awesome, but it can also can be a bad thing. If that person doesn’t feel the same, then you are in a one-sided, or unrequited, situation. It does you no good if you are in this situation. You need to fall in love with someone who already likes you a lot, and is attracted to you. Falling in love with someone who simply likes you as a friend could be a bad situation, but sometimes can grow from friendship to love. Just make sure you are both on the same page before letting those feelings happen. You can usually tell when you both are feeling something special for eachother.

When you're young and a tiny bit idealistic, you may have this Disneyesque idea. That there's a person out there. Somewhere in this world. Most likely very, very far away. The person who is your perfect love. Your half. The person with butterflies hovering all around. And rainbows shining out of their butt. As per the legend, you are supposed to locate each other, guided by nothing more than a sheer instinct. And when the magical moment happens, you unite in a blissful union and live happily ever after. Making babies and sailing Mediterranean. At the same time. Then you keep growing older and getting crunchier. The puberty is long over but the magic didn't happen. You kept waiting and waiting. You kept searching for your true love in the cold shiny eyes of strangers. But it didn't come. So, you sort of give up on that idea quietly. You stash it away as far as you can. It was just a silly childhood theory after all. You pair up with whomever seems a proper choice and get on the best you can. By the time that fails, you don't even think about your “love” anymore. Then, someday you freeze in your tracks. Because there's something about that someone you just met. That your mind is just so excitedly stubborn about, as a dog with a fresh bone. You get closer to have a better look. For sure, it's nothing. But no, it sure as hell does look like your silly teenage dream. Except that it's not perfect. It's somewhat misshapen and tied to this person with flaws and reality. Frustrated, you try to swim away quickly. And then you realize that you can't. It hurts. The more you try to swim away, the harder it hurts. So, you return. And feel whole, for the first time in your life. Together, you can rule the world. Apart, you can't even tie your shoes. You're paralyzed by the all-consuming fear of losing something precious and irreplaceable. The Universe tells you to be together. No matter what. You're in love.

When we cannot stop ourself from thinking about that person, every moment every second. When talking to that person , never feels enough. When our heart skips a beat at their sight, or their approach. When we begin missing the person, the moment we loose sight of each other. When talking all day about that person, to our friends and family doesn't seem enough. When we sleep with his/ her thoughts, and wake up with the same. When dreams revolve around him/ her. When his/ her choices seems the best in this world. When his/her priorities becomes ours. When a single hurt to that person brings in a great hurt in us. When his/her life aim, becomes our priority. When we think of all possible ways, and make efforts to make that person the happiest in this world. When his/her voice becomes the greatest music of all times. When we crave to keep listening to the deep down talks and thoughts of that person and some where keep relating ous own. When a mistaken touch gives a goose bump and we keep on recalling the scenario, if it just happened ? When our eyes stops resting on anyone else but that very person, when it comes to feelings, love, life. When mind frames, multiple imaginary scenarios of a happy life, full of love with that person. When all the love songs, begin to top our playlist. When being called the greatest bathroom singer becomes a moment of pride. When we think of all great stuffs to gift that person, just to bring a smile and to make him/her feel our love and compassion towards them. Every time when our heart skips a beat at his/ her smile, and wishes to god , to preserve that smile forever. When we crave to live forever, an eternal love life with him/her. When a single thought of misfortune, gives chills, and when our hands join tighter and head kneels lowers amidst the almighty, to be in favour always. The list is an endless one, I can go on forever. I guess I should stop for now, with this message, that “ Love is the greatest and the strongest feeling of this world”. If ever you get this true feeling, Accept it, Confess it, and never let that person go, let the Love grow, forever and ever.

Lust - when you want their body; them at their best; whenever you’re in the mood; it’s selfish & all about you & never them; you think about & want them the way you want them; afterwards you’re through with them; when they do something that displease you, you despise them; your patience with them is as a gnat. You could live without them. Love - love like a mother; love like a sibling; love like a friend; love like a dear & close friend. Love❤️ In Love - It is unique & special & one of a kind love. You can only love one person at any given time like this cause there is no time, room or capacity in your being to give yourself & of yourself. It is the total opposite of lust. You want their body, mind & spirit. You take the good with the bad. You love their truth & can put up with their lies if they can give plausible explanations. It’s not about you; nor just them but it’s about us & we (are one unit). How can we be better (together). You share your time, talents & treasures with each other. You become better because of them. You don’t mind being vulnerable & transparent because you trust them with your secrets. You’re consumed in your conscious & subconscious with positive thoughts about them & us; in your dreams & it’s a nightmare without them. In Love is you & them together, forever. WE IS ONE! That’s when you know that you are IN LOVE!
